column2: Nice views and experience at the Malibu beach
column3: Pier and restaurant was closed, but was able to walk out onto the beach and dip my feet into the Pacific Ocean on a beautiful day. People were definitely out on the beaches. Very nice area. Picturesque.

column2: Picturesque and Pricey stop along the 101!
column3: Very picturesque and much more low key then the various Piers to the South. Breakfast was just “ok” at Malibu Farm but may have just been our selections. We enjoyed our brief stop here during our Pacific Coast Adventure. It does get pricey quickly though! Would probably skip on next 101 trip.

We drove with my adult son and his young family to the Malibu pier to enjoy the President's Day holiday. While the pier and its restaurants and shop were good and interesting, the prices of everything from parking ($15) to a wooden, toy 6-inch pickup truck ($74) to the breakfast food (over $100 for 3 adults) were lofty. But, the ocean view and the half-hidden mansions on the hill beach-side were, indeed, spectacular. This pier is much more laid-back than either the Venice Beach or Santa Monica Piers and is worth a trip on a nice day.

After beginning our day in Malibu at the marvellous Pepperdine University campus we took a bus back to the pier.We enjoyed a relaxing pleasant amble to the end, revelling in the oceans views and gentle bustle. It’s a popular spot for fishing and hiring of boats.Ample cafes and eateries are onboard and we enjoyed a coffee and cappuccino in one.

column2: Beautiful setting and view, and food is good too
column3: Beautiful setting and view. We ate at the cafe part at the end of the pier. The food was very good, much better than you'd expect considering that it's such an obvious place for tourists etc. Our only complaint is that there were quite a few flies buzzing around when we were there. Otherwise 5 stars. And of course expect it to be very crowded at peak seasons and times.
Nice pier with shops and food. Great view out both ways showing the coastline and hills. Clean and not crowded.

We started at the Malibu pier and strolled south down the beach for about a mile and a half to an obvious Rockpoint and then came back. Beach is perfect for a stroll, and the houses are quite varied and worth looking out from the ocean side.

Lovely stroll and views, a great cafe at the base of the pier, it wasn't busy on the day we were there, very relaxing. We walked there along the beach from the place we stayed in Malibu, but if you drive keep in mind that the parking next to the pier is $15. You can park for free in the Malibu Country Mart if you don't mind about 15 mins walk from there to the pier.

Spent the day at Malibu Lagoon State Beach-Surf Rider, and the Pier. It was awesome shopping on the Pier, and watching the Surfers from Surf Rider beach. Amazing views in all directions. Great day for families, friends and couples. The pic with this post is a vendor selling jewelry.

Being from Europe, you see and hear about Malibu Beach on many TV shows/films. It was definitely a place a wanted to stop off at on our way from LA to Santa Barbara. BUT, did I miss the only parking place there was?Driving up the PCH we thought there would be numerous stops to park up and wander on down to the beach. The beachfront from LA through Malibu appears to be house after house with no openings down to the beach. We approached Malibu Pier on our left and decided to ride past it thinking there would be other parking opportunities a little further down the road (like there is at Santa Monica). If there were, we couldn't find any. It seems the rich and famous not only have access to their beautiful homes but the stretch of beachfront in front of them. The one place we managed to find access on to the beach was just past Starbucks on a narrow street but there was no parking and the beachfront area in front of the houses seemed cordoned off.We didn't have time to double back on ourselves to try the Pier again so we kept going. Tried parking at Point Dume but with only about 8 car parking spaces and clamping in effect for illegally parking in the streets nearby, we had to bypass this one too. Finally we reached Zuma Beach. Lovely stretch of sand with some big waves.I get if you have the money to buy one of these million dollar homes, you don't want nosey tourists peering in at you from the beach but I was disappointed that it wasn't quite as I'd expected.
Walked the Pier while in town. Nice Stroll, enjoyed watching nearby surfers. Did not dine at restaurant but looked tasty.

I always drove by this place and never stopped by, so I parked my car along PCH a mile south, then walked back towards the pier on the beach.The coast line on this part of Malibu was beautiful, with the view of ocean and million dollars houses. If you walk north toward pier, there are rock formations in front of Malibu pier, you can’t cross over the rocks, and climb up to the pier bridge. So, you may go up the stairs toward Nobu hotel parking, and walk on the sidewalk of PCH to get to the Malibu Pier sign. Parking in this area is 15-20＄range, in busy summer time.
I know this has to be done but really not that impressive unless you want a different angle on the hundreds of surfers in the water.

I love the laid back vibe of the Malibu pier. Malibu Farm offers great food and that Cali cool atmosphere and the gift shop at the end of the pier has a great selection of unique things for everyone on your list.

There is really not much exiting going on here, but if you are in the area, it is worth visiting. because of its place in popular culture. Many films have been shot at the per and it is an impressive structure. People actually catch fish there, there is a restaurant and a couple of souvenir shops. They also have public restrooms. The view towards the ocean and the California coast is awesome so cameras are a must. Parking will be a problem in busy days.

Definitely worth a stop. $10 to park for that short stop however. Nice shot of the Malibu coast and the surfers in the distance. The two food places looked quaint but pricey as expected. Lots of people fishing from the pier.We moved further down the PCH to watch the sunset.

column2: Great spot for a short visit
column3: I have to start by saying we are a couple in our 60’s.We enjoyed our visit. It was a nice way to spend an hour or so on a lovely afternoon.But I’m sure the younger visitors who were interested in the rides would have given 5 stars.The view up the beach in either direction was great.We stopped to watch a magician which was a bit of fun and we also ate hotdogs and enjoyed them.A good stop on our visit to the area.
Beautiful views of the ocean however nothing to do other than eat or shop in 1 small tourist shop. The restaurants are pricey but well worth it as the food and service were excellent.

There were many local fishermen, although the entire time we were there we didn’t see one fish caught. There are 2 restaurants on the pier, same menus. Both serve very good food. Parking is a challenge as you can do street parking or paid parking. In the afternoon it was $15 and later that night it was $10. One small gift shop is permanent and there was also 2 temporary vendors selling items.

column2: Beautiful scenery, but not much to the pier.
column3: We are from the east coast, near Philly, Pa. We spent a week in Southern California, then drove up the Pacific Coast Highway taking in the beautiful sights and stopping at several towns/places along the way. Malibu is beautiful to see, however the pier is really nothing special and if someone asked me, I'd say; "Skip it." Yes there are homes belonging to the rich and famous, actors, whoever, but it is very private and secluded and really - just a beach with great views/natural beauty.

If you are visiting Malibu this is a must. If you just want to walk out onto the pier you will see surfers, sea life and amazing views of the Pacific ocean and panoramic views of Malibu. If you want to go to the pier and eat, Malibu Farms restaurant is wonderful and great ocean view dining. There is parking at the end of the pier which you have to pay for, but very convenient. This is also a great place to see celebrity sightings if that is your thing. Overall, well worth the trip.
Drove through here on our way up to Santa Barbara. Awesome diner called Neptune’s which was in a lot of movies. Cool place to stop, with tons of places to take great picts.

column2: Gorgeous pier with amazing food and views
column3: If you visit Malibu, then I recommend you visit the pier. Although it's short, the cafe and views are amazing.

Walk down the pier and look out over the north side. railing. Take in the view of nice breakers on scores of wet suit clad surfers jockeying for position or enjoying a ride. Look close and you might find a present day Gidget or Moondoogie riding the surf or on the beach with toes in the sand. This is a legendary pier and beach area. Take a walk on the beach and around the point and lagoon. Parking is on PCH or in adjacent fair priced lots. Rent a kayak or a surf or paddle board and give it a go. Beach Boys music 🎶 will be on your mind. Enjoy!

column2: Just a stroll on the pier
column3: Came to restaurant and took a stroll to e d of pier to see water. Bought a souvenir in shop and snapped a few photos of coast and surfers near/at Surf Beach. Cool overcast day but still pleasant.

Great pier and something not to be missed. Couple of eateries, that had some fantastic food on offer, what a location to dine alfresco. Some great independent shops, that had some unique products on offer, a little pricey but th is is Malibu after all...Lucky enough to see a pod of dolphins from the end of the pier, really made the visit worthwhile.Definitely the place to take a leisurely stroll while in Malibu, relaxed, fun and what a vibe.

column2: Basic pier with amazing view - shop and restaurant at end surprises
column3: Basic pier with awesome view with a nice surprise at the end in a super high end shop at the end. Shop has all sorts of high end items to take home. The restaurant is amazing right next door.
Nothing exciting. There is a restaurant here and the view is OK. If you're passing through, it isn't a bad stop.

Very little going on on this pier late March evening. Understand where you are: $150 sweat shirts, $45 T shirts and $15 small chocolate bar. Maybe 3 chocolates instead of a T is a good deal, at least in Malibu!Bars on pier near shore end were populated, but not very busy. One time visit.

column2: The breakfast at Malibu Pier is the must!
column3: If you are in Malibu you have to eat the breakfast at Malibu Pier. The best if you sit outside at the sun viewing beauty of the ocean and colorful hills around.

Not really too much to do on Malibu Pier... it’s nice for a slow wander, to have a sticky beak at the couple of little shops or to enjoy a meal, but otherwise not much going on.Great for some pics of the surfers or looking back towards Malibu and the hills.A pretty stop if you’ve never been before.

Not much more to say, a pier is a pier. Has a few shops and places to eat nearby. We were there in the middle of the day but I imagine watching a sunset from there would be lovely. Worth stopping at if you’re driving past.
We walked along about 4.00 in the afternoon hoping for a hot drink but nothing was open. Not really impressive.

lovely walk after lunch at the farm, middle of December and sun was out and nearly 20 degrees. the views of the end looking right down the coast made the trip all the better. The drive down to it through the hills was both beautiful and truly awful due to the fires that had ravished the hills during November.

We had a yummy brunch here recently! The place reminded me of Mackinac Island, in our beloved Michigan. We dined upstairs and had a fabulous view of the Pacific Ocean. Everything was spectacular. An all around wonderful experience! Going back or sure next time!!

This Pier has beautiful views of the Coast and inland areas around Malibu. There are quaint shops, lovely restaurants and a beautiful handcrafted "make a wish" Timber swing where you can take unforgettable pictures!

Great place to spend a nice afternoon taking in the sunshine and fresh air. You can pack a lunch, or get food at the restaurants on the pier. People watch as people walk by or are fishing. You can also stroll on the beach.
We love visiting Malibu pier, checking out the little pop up shops on the pier, and having lunch at Malibu Farms. The pier is beautiful and my son enjoyed watching fishermen fish!
It is paradise, including the restaurants and shop. Waitstaff and store assistance were all so nice. It is a happy place.
We loved our visit to Malibu and the pier! Great atmosphere and beautiful views! Also it is free!!!!

Perfect place to start a visit to Malibu. A great cafe sits on thevend of the pier serving breakfast and all-day fare. A full bar/restaurant at 5ge start odiferous the pier serving also dinner. Great for people watching and a perfect jumping-off point for beach walking and wading.
Did not eat at establishments, but the pier is a most outstanding place to watch a Pacific sunset and maybe just hang in the surf.

column2: Pleaseant Breakfast on the Malibu Pier
column3: My wife and I ate breakfast twice on the Malibu Pier. The food was excellent, the view is great, and the service was good. It was not crowded which made it all the more enjoyable.

column2: A little fishing, breakfast and a walk in the sun!
column3: Parking is right beside the pier and $10 a day.The pier itself doesn’t have a lot on it but we hired a fishing rod and bait for $22 for 2 hours, didn’t catch anything but it was fun.Had breakfast and just chilled in the sun, trying to guess who lives in the houses and watching paddle boarders.It’s a nice way to spend a few hours.
The pier is good to visit for a few minutes, 30 at most, but the beach at the pier is laid back, comfortable, friendly and fun. My kids and I spent the entire day there!

The views are great the food is good and the atmosphere has a little bit to be desired. Unfortunately the homeless or problem I don’t you find a place for them to stay so you can enjoy this day and not the stench
A nice place to stroll when you are in Malibu, take a look out for film crews, they often film there for Malibu Rescue, the new Netflix tv show.

column2: Long Walk on a Short Pier makes for a Relaxing Day-
column3: With our California Weather being so Co-operative, this is a place you can usually call your Own during the week and the normal 9 months of year. Of-course, until the 3 months of Summer when the World is traveling, then the secret is out and the crowds and traffic make it crowded and noisy! we understand all good things should be shared and this is definitely one of the Good places- enjoy and relax on the Beaches, Hiking to the Falls, Shopping the Boutiques and Sales and the Casual & Comfortable Dinning spots- there is something for everyone-

column2: Fell in love with this place!
column3: We are a family from England and stayed in Long Beach but had a drive up to Malibu one afternoon.We managed to park in the parking lot and took a walk along the Pier - how quaint with beautiful wooden beams and a great gift shop plus lovely restaurants.We stood and watched local people fishing and the surfers too!We really fell in love with it and have been recommending to everyone back home.
Lovely pier - fully wooden deck, nice small stalls, cute restaurant at the end. Feels very relaxed compared to some of the other bigger piers. You can watch surfers on the beach. Recommend!
The Malibu Pier offers eclectic shops and the lovely Malibu Farm dining. A lovely stroll with surfers and fishermen all around. We enjoyed a fresh lunch and vino listening to the gentle surf.

The restaurants on the pier were crowded and hectic. No one coordinated a welcome, as there are two check-in booths across from one another. We chose indiscriminately and found our own seats. No one really noticed our arrival, so we left and went back to our favorite spot, Carbon Beach Cafe.

Decided to have a drive to Malibu on our visit to L.A.. Came across the pier just in time to watch the sunset. Lovely & tranquil with just the body boarders in the foreground. Visiting the little shop.

We stopped in Malibu on our drive down Highway1. We experienced great views and by visiting in the morning it was very peaceful and quiet. I like the laid back feel of the area and there are a few shops and cafes to stop at.

We went to the Malibu Pier in the morning of a sunny day. The morning fog made it had to take good pictures of the coastline but it was nice for some close up shots.It was a laid back experience walking along the pier, as there weren’t many people there - mostly fisherman and locals.I do prefer Santa Monica Pier as there is more to do and it’s a bit more exciting but if you prefer the quiet life then this is for you.It’s free to walk along the pier and there are two cafes - one at the entrance and one at the end of the pier. There are also some small shops which sell merchandise along the pier as well which were nice to stop at and have a look.The parking around the pier is free - you can choose between the car park or street parking.It’s quite close to the small Malibu township which has some cute boutiques and restaurants.It was nice to visit, probably wouldn’t go back to the pier again unless there was a reason to do so.
It’s good to be here at the morning and listen tide and feel the fresh air and fresh day.Quite clean, already opened caffe some fishermen here.Good good.

We went to ride the ferris wheel. We had seen it in movies so many times that we had to. Place is a little run down, but great atmosphere. We rented the bikes from there and were off to ride on Venice beach.

This Pier is okay but nothing compared to the Santa Monica Pier. Good views of the sunset but that's about it. And if you like fishing, this is also a good spot for that. The restaurants are highly popular and had long queues when we were there.
We had our reunion at Pacific Cove Beach Club so we took a stroll to the pier. The weather was perfect and the water was warmer than usual. Malibu is a beautiful area however traffic was very heavy.

Went there on a Saturday morning, the sun out - the dolphins playing ... and expected a brilliant view and prepared to have some mediocre food at tourist trap prices. Sure this place is not cheap - and spending $57 (including tax and tip) for two breakfasts, a coffee and a cappuccino is not exactly a bargain.Nevertheless, we liked the food, were well fed and, most importantly, had an amazing morning sitting on the deck and watching the dolphins play.Let me make myself very clear: this is not "the best breakfast I ever had" and I do find $6 for a cappuccino and $4 for a serve-yourself coffee (plus tax and tip, of course) questionable. Well then, this place is simply amazing - far from being as crowded as the Santa Monica Pier. And amazingness does almost always come with a price tag. If you've never been and want to hang out and chill - this is the place to go. And if you are on a tight budget, get fed at Jack in the box across the street and have a coffee or a soda here. It's definitely worth going, hence the five stars (I would have possibly given four, but I wanted to make up for people rating this place with one star only with the comment "...Parking is not enough at street. Have to pay to park.... ").
Highly recommend going there. Get there early. Because parking is rough. A lot of European tourist. Free to get on and the. Each is great also

column2: Nice pier with great food and views.
column3: Nice beach and great lunch spot the Farm on the pier in several spots! Little shop at end of the pier, see the surfers out to the right or fishermen at the end.Not the action of Santa Monica but a great low key beach afternoon for all.

column2: Doesn't live up to the hype
column3: It's a pier, you can walk along it and see the sea - but the hype around Malibu as a premier destination with palms and sunsets is overdone. Yes it's near LA / Hollywood but we found more picturesque beaches further down the coast towards San Diego. But, there is cool beachside campsite (mainly for RVs) at Thornhill Broome / Point Mugu just west of Malibu.

column2: Was Expecting a little bit more
column3: Well the Pier is nothing special frankly speaking although keeps the classic California style.It's nice the view on the Bay, very quiet in the morning.Suggest for a short view of Malibu and for Hill House Watching.
The Malibu Pier is a beautiful location overlooking a wonderful beach that you can access from the entrance to the pier.
Worth a visit, relaxed Malibu style. Enjoy and have a breakfas or lunch at the beginning of the pier
Cool and quiet place, nice jewelry and accessories shop, nice ice creams. Worth going and spending some time especially in the morning

column2: A very short pier! had a great ice cream though
column3: I lived in LA for 30 years and I never went to this pier so on a recent visit back, we went to Malibu pier. It isn't very long and there is not a lot on it, but there is a cute looking (expensive - duh this is Malibu) organic restaurant. We stopped in the shop and had THE BEST ice cream sandwiches ever. They were expensive but homemade and good. The big question is, it it worth the effort and money to park the car? I say no. However, if you have someone like we did who dropped us off so we could do a quick 20 minutes on the pier and get the ice cream, I say go for it.
Nice view of the ocean but to me that's about it unless you go to the restaurant there. Most of the banches are dirty and /or used by fishermen.

Such a beautiful area so romantic and so relaxing take time to just sit back and watch the waves A great way to remove stress and be with the one you love just to spend time together in a beautiful place
We stopped at the pier for lunch at The farm cafe. The crepes with fruit and cream were great. It's a very pretty pier, especially if you walk under it and sling the beach.

We went out of our way to visit this pier, and I wouldn't do it again. There are really just 2 restaurants (good, but not any better than many other restaurants that are more convenient), one gift shop (interesting but expensive), and people fishing off the pier. Difficult and expensive to park. It is pretty, but, other than that, I fail to see the appeal. Plenty of other places for nice views in the area.
Crowds, food, views and more of the same as this pier juts out into the Pacific enabling viewers an up front and personal ocean experience, but the pier itself, a pretty touristy spot.
Cannot say you have to be experienced a southern Cali beach and not got ocean wet in Malibu. Make life easy, park in the lot next to the pier! Most awesome of beaches!

column2: Take a break from the traffic on pch
column3: Families stationed as they enjoy fishing.Not alot of unoccupied benches so just keep it moving.3 places to eat, a handful of vendors.
Came here with our son after surfing for lunch and to see a tourist destination. Ended up eating at the Malibu Market at the end of the pier. Was a fun place to people watch.

There a restaurant (Malibu Farms), cafe (smaller menu but delicious), gift shop, ice cream vendor, and like 1-2 other vendors. The pier offers great views and you can see some world famous surfing. But small so it’s not an all day experience. The beach is right next to the pier. It was clean and well taken care of. Lots of people fishing off the side. Good people watching!
Peaceful, safe, clean and simply beautiful scenery. Mailbu Pier is a gorgeous setting in a gorgeous place with the heart of Malibu at your feet.

Malibu pier was my favorite of all the beach pier/boardwalks in the area. It was less crowded than the others in the area. The gift shop was overpriced but fun to look around in. We ate at both the malibu farm cafe and the malibu farm restaurant. Both were amazing! Parking is iffy. We got street spots twice but then paid $10 to park in a lot another time.
This is a very short and therefore intimate pier. It is gear towards food and is not at all commercialised. Our lunch was good if not a tad expensive but then this is Malibu.
Nice place to have a nice walk and hang out with friends. Lots of people doing shows and fishing. Very recommended to go
Beautiful area. Great beach access. Cute shops and restaurants to eat and wander around. $10 to park. Fun place to stop on the Pacific Coast Highway.
This is worth a quick stop and maybe for something to eat. It isnt much but a cool little place to visit.
Wow breath taking view of the ocean and its surroundings. The pier is well done, with plenty of places to eat. Great place to stop and enjoy the view.

Lovely beach, great atmosphere and unique houses built right by the sea.The water is a little rough for swimming but good for surf.Proximity to LA is appealling.I recommend this beach area for sunsets and lovely vistas.
Not a long stop unless you are eating (we ate further up the coast) but a lovely little bay and perhaps the most pristine pier I've seen, freshly painted

Highly recommend the grilled salmon sandwich and then Swedish mini pancakes. Loved the arugula and olive touch with the sandwich... the mini pancakes with the blueberries were simply delightfully! The coffee was fantastic and the OJ freshly squeezed and sweet.I would go back even for just the view and ambiance!
A nice pleasant stroll along the pier in the evening sun. The gentle swell of the Pacific Ocean hissing beneath the Pier added to the atmosphere. Magic !

column2: Malibu Pier is a nice walk into the Sunshine !!
column3: We left Santa Monica and headed to Malibu to eventually get on the Pacific Coast Highway and stopped by the pier. Its a lazy walk and easy on the feet, not as nice as Santa Monica, but fishing is available and there are restaurants to have brunch. We didn't eat but we enjoyed our stay for the short time we were there.

column2: The Pacific Ocean is a Wonder to Visit
column3: Take a walk, yes a simple walk. Few things are as soothing peaceful and energizing all at the same time as a walk along the coast. So when you are driving on the Pacific Coast Highway pump those brakes and pull over! Walk with your toes touching the Malibu sand. Smell the ocean, feel the breeze! What do you have to lose?

column2: Relaxing.....if you are not in a hurry.
column3: The only bad thing about this area is that it's hard to find a parking spot on the weekends. But if you are not in a hurry it's a nice place to stroll. Be careful though with the birds. A bird once flew into my son's head!! And also, it's very windy, so watch out for your hat!! If you are from out of town, this is one place you will want to see. There is nothing like it.

We visited Malibu pier early morning and enjoyed brunch in the resturant. The pier is nice. Its old and full of character. There are places to eat and drink and great photo opps. Would recommended it to anyone driving that way along the Pacfic Highway.We parked on the road for free. Some parking is availalbe at cost around the pier.

column2: Offers nice views of the coast
column3: An enjoyable walk out to the end of the pier with a tourist gift shop and a restaurant with beer, light meals and sandwiches. But the best reason to visit is for the view.

column2: A must see for tourists and us locals.
column3: Great pier, incredible view of Surfrider Beach, nice little shop and restaurant at the end of the pier...we grew up in California and still love going to Malibu pier.

column2: Scenic but less activity than expected
column3: This pier was built in 1905 and was recommended to us for buying souvenirs and postcards. We parked at a nearby public lot for $10. The pier itself is lovely for a stroll with restaurants on either end, outdoor seating and beautiful views of Malibu Beach below. The souvenir shopping however was more of a flop. There were literally no regular picture postcards to be found. The two stores (one on each end) had wooden ones, which I know would never make it to Europe in one piece. The other souvenirs were not that great either. Overall I much prefer the fun Santa Monica Pier.
just enough to look at or eat while strolling but not overdone and gaudy. It's essential malibu. I'll stroll here each time I go back to Malibu.
We strolled on the Malibu Pier, where it was fun to people watch and see the fun beach homes of the celebrities nearby.
Beautiful restaurant that is on the ocean. Highly recommend going and try making a reservation before you arrive. The freshest farm-to-table location around LA.

There are two eateries on the Pier. One at each end. Each one serves great tasty food all day and evening. If you think Piers only have junk food.........this Pier certainly doesn’t. Parking isn’t simple. $10.00 unless you can park on the PCH. It’s certainly worth eating here - especially if you are hungry.
I love spending an afternoon here strolling the pier after having brunch at Malibu Farm, there's a lot of young people, families, surfers, couples... it's safe and beautiful.
Nice place to visit some beautiful homes around here, a pleasant drive walked to the end of the pier. Gets quite windy. Lovely sunsets.
Great place to stroll and watch local people fish and enjoy the pacific. Loved the sun and surf here. Very nice place to spend some time.
We walked the pier in November last year. It was nice with quaint shops to browse. We picked up a few gifts for the grandkids and had brunch at a lovely place at the edge of the pier.
Stunning views. The beach is quiet, clean and well looked after. There are lots of restaurants around too. Makes the perfect day out.
Chillax. Read a book. Chat with family and friends. Explore the view. Do fishing.. stare at the vastness of the sea...You can take loads of pics. Excellent to have professional photography here.
It was nice to visit and walk along the beach and pier but there’s not much to do , it was really quiet and we soon moved on to Santa Monica
This is one of the best hidden secrets in Malibu with EXCELLENT ocean front tables outside, food including vegan, vegetarian, pescatarian and meat. Totally casual.

column2: Perhaps the best stop in Malibu
column3: Perhaps the best stop in Malibu. Quintessential at least. In one spot you get the Gidget surfer culture, ocean views, and perhaps a seal. Crazy parking and chaos on the Pacific Coast Highway, or PCH in local lingo. For food I would wait until Neptune’s Net if I was driving north.

column2: nice place though not much for activity
column3: this place is nice to live for sure:) but for visiting nice to eat something and go back to other beaches for activity.
Ate breakfast at the Pier restaurant and sat outside on top overlooking the ocean. We could watch the surfers while eating our breakfast. We had the breakfast burritos!
Restaurant has good view but not the cuisine. The waiters are nice. But the prices are a bit high for the snacks.
Beautiful beach and pier - if you can't find free parking on the road, there are lots directly across the street from the pier for $10-15 dollars for the day

If you're on a private tour, make the stop. If you're driving and don't live in Malibu, don't bother. The traffic is absolutely atrocious in Malibu, but I do understand why...it's beautiful. Walked out on the pier and could've stayed there all day and just watched the waves, the surfers, paddleboarders, and the world go by. It's very peaceful and tranquil just watching the water. There is an organic restaurant on the pier and if you have the time, do it as the views cannot be beat. The thing I like about the pier is that there isn't a lot to do here (like the craziness of Santa Monica), but is just a slower pace where you can relax and take in the views.

If you're looking for a lot of stuff to do, then maybe this isn't the place for you. We loved that it wasn't too busy, rather a beautiful setting with a good restaurant, café, and shop. The shops are ridiculously expensive, but no more so than Hollywood, Santa Monica Pier, etc., IMO. The restaurant is gorgeous with great options, but questionable service (not a huge deal to us, although it really stood out since our experience at most other places in the area included top notch service). We enjoyed walking here from our hotel, the Malibu Beach Inn (which was incredible) daily. The cappuccinos at the Malibu Farm Market café were not good - stay away ;) My husband loved his freshly squeezed lemonade, though!
Has a shop and you see some surfers....whatever......has a shop and a cafe and you see some surfers.....whatever......

The traffic is absolutely hectic in the area and if you do not live here is not worth traveling here simply to see the pier.The area though is stunning with Getty villa dominating the area near the pier, lots of stunning houses up the cliff or mountain... or near the ocean, thus subject to the permanent erosion the ocean produces.If I had the money, I would not mind having a large house in this area too: what could you complain about? Just sun, sea and great weather almost all year round.

column2: Not worth the trip to Malibu
column3: We were not particularly impressed with Malibu as a whole and the pier which was one of the highest ranked attraction behind the Getty museum was not inspiring. I would only bother to visit Malibu if you are keen on the beaches and these are not the best on the Los Angeles coast line. If you do visit, there appeared to be quite a bit of free roadside parking when we visited so you could save yourself the $10 parking in the pier car park, we were however there out of peak season.

column2: Take a Stroll Down the Pier
column3: The pier offers great views of Malibu, plus has a bunch of cute shops and a cafe. Take an hour and hang out on the pier, surrounded by the beautiful view and sea breeze.
I love the uncrowded feel of the pier. I think it's a mellow place to visit.It's a great stop on the PCH after a beach walk and some seafood.

Considering the area is so well known around the world, the pier was a little bit of a wash really. There's nothing on there apart from a couple of shops. Was still nice to see it but wouldn't rush back.Parking was $106/10
If your in the area this is a relaxing place to visit the food at the end of the pier is the best sea food the rest is just carnavial food

Not that much to do here especially compared to Santa Monica Pier. However the location is great and if you can find parking you might enjoy a meal at the restaurant. Lots of locals were going fishing. Birds in the area were also nice.

column2: Expensive but it’s the end of Route 66
column3: Coffee $6 parking on the pier at $3 per hour.Don’t make the mistake we did and park next to the pier if you only want a quick visit. It is $13 but if you’re there for the day it’s good value and you can walk to the shops and restaurants, if you don’t want to pay the pier prices.Large amount of clean serviced toilets.

column2: What's With All The Good Reviews
column3: First there is no parking; zero, notta, none. Madhouse! There is nothing on this pier except a restaurant and gift shop at the end of the pier and a cafe style by the road. That's it nothing else; zero, notta, nothing! The place is ugly and rundown and this includes the entire Highway 1 through Malibu. Seriously... litter, weeds, homeless people. Wake up California!

Nice place for a walk above the water with a long view. Several well placed benches along the way. Nice little snack shack at the end, with an upper level that has even better views. Say a few fishermen on the day we went.
Terrific place to visit when in Malibu. Great tourist shops a couple of bars and some great looking restaurants. Particularly good photo spot looking back to Santa Monica

We arrived in the evening to watch the sunset. The pier was great to walk out on to see the sunset into the horizon. There is a souvenir shop at the beginning of the pier as well as a small farmers market. You can also access Malibu beach from stairs by the pier. The entire area is beautiful. Don't miss a chance to view a sunset here.
Have a drink and snacks at malibu farm restaurant or brekky at malibu farm cafe both on the pier. Grwat place to visit

We came here on our way back from Santa Monica for a little lunch break. The location is amazing as it feels sitting on the water. We had some Pizza and Salad dishes. Everything tasted so good and totally fresh. It is a great spot and I would love to come back.

When vising Malibu, nobody should pass up stopping at and walking the Malibu Pier! Through the years, the storms and fires have tried to beat up this site. Thankfully, they keep repairing the buildings back to their original look. Currently, there are a couple of good eateries to sit and enjoy the surroundings. Also, Surfrider beach is adjacent, to be able to walk the beach and watch the surfers battle for waves.

Got to the quite well known pier. Crowded with people and lots of interesting characters.Prices not cheap for touristy items but the place is buzzing and all with a cool sea breezeGlad we saw it, strolled it
Walking back from the gym across the street from the Malibu Beach Inn, I took a walk out onto the Pier. Got a good look at the surfer's break at Carbon Beach. Looks like lots of funny, touristy shops
Stop here to watch the fishermen & to have breakfast or lunch at Malibu Farm. Beautiful views & fresh air. Can be difficult to park in some of these areas at busy times.

I planned to stop here for a couple of days to surf the local break but after one day I had enough. I grew up in Northern Ireland and had less hostility there. Parking was impossible but for the fact I arrived at 4am. The area is run down unless you live in one of the overpriced homes. The only friendly people I met where a group of homeless guys. I ended up spending the afternoon talking to them and when we parted company they asked for nothing. It's a terrible world we live in when the only truly happy people in Malibu aren't the mega rich and famous but are the guys that have nothing.

column2: Good for some relaxing and people watching
column3: Great place to relax and people watch.....ferris wheel is a must and provides great photo opportunities......
One of the nicest places for breakfast on the w coast. Food great and service efficient. A must do on any west coast trip
There are some shops such as cafe, shorts shop, and veggie shop. Nice view with cool wind. Lots of people enjoyed fishing.

column2: A nice sunset, quieter than Santa Monica
column3: We drove particularly to visit Malibu. We stopped by a nice seafood place just minutes before reaching the pier, and it was fantastic, so we didn't have the chance to visit the restaurant within the pier itself. Otherwise, beautiful and worth visiting, way quieter than Santa Monica.
Nice pier with a very interesting and lovely store at the end.Around the pier, the beach is the best place in the area for stand-up paddle and swimming activities
Lovely and relaxing to walk along the pier. Lots to watch. Cute shop at the end and lovely cocktails! Definitely worth a visit!

Passing by, decided to stop. Full parking lot, but one space available under direction of parking attendant.Walked out to the end of the old wooden pier. Fun people watching, high surf. We ate at the café at the end of the pier.Glad we stopped.

This beautiful restaurant has perfect ocean views coupled with the most excellent food! Every dish we tried was superb - we loved it so much we made sure to return the following day. Plus - on a beautiful summer morning - there's no place better to start your day. Also - fun place to purchase some Malibu swag.
Really nice old wooden pier. Nice to walk along and watch the guys fishing. Had a good brunch to at the cafe at the start
it is the place you have seen so many times in so many movies and tv series. it is exactly how you can imagine.

column2: Great view, a bit crowded at prime times
column3: This is a great spot to bring out of town guests. You can park close by, grab a bite at the restaurants, do a bit of shopping, access the beach or just take in the great views.

My husband and I enjoyed our time on the pier. We were able to get some great photos and views of the water. We ate at the restaurant located towards the end of the pier. The restaurant served organic food and drinks. I ordered the quesadilla and honestly it was by far the best that I had ever had. As for the drink, I should have stuck with water because the specialty drinks they have taste totally different from what you will imagine that it tastes like. Nevertheless, there is no cost to walk on the pier however, you have to pay to park. We had to pay $10 to park. It is time based. You will pay for parking right before you exit the parkingLot to the parking lot attendant. Overall, it's something to do once just to mark it off the list.

I would say this pier and beach are a must see. A bit dated but there's some shopping, live music and food. The view from the end of the pier is beautiful! Parking isn't as bad as you would think and you are near the major shopping area in Malibu as well!

We finally paid for parking after now being able to park on a mid-weekday. I couldn’t believe there wasn’t any parking at all! So we went a ways away, paid for parking and then walked the pier. Then, that was it? There’s nothing there. This pier is ridiculous and is popular only for the namesake. It is crowded with people there but there really isn’t anything at all to speak of there. What a disappointment.
Not much to see on the Malibu pier specifically, but the view of the ocean from the pier was great. The waves were very large for southern California! Try the Malibu Farm while visiting the pier.

column2: Nice walk on the pier to just look or eat a meal.
column3: We always enjoy walking on a pier wherever we may be traveling. The Malibu Pier great and if the surf is up you can watch the surfers. The fishing is always interesting to watch even if you do not fish. The Farm is great to eat at. Parking on the highway is free but parking on the Pier Parking lot will cost you. Many times we will park and walk on the pier and then walk up the coast and view the many splendid beach front homes in the Malibu Colony.

The pier is a great place to sit along and watch the surfers and waves crashing onto the shore. Beautiful views of some of the houses up on the hills. There was a nice breeze and a sense of peacefulness. I will definitely be back to visit the pier. The restaurant at the pier, not so much

We visited he pier this week while in Los Angeles.Besides the restaurant at the beginning of the pier and the shop, there is limited things to do in the area right off the PCH.Definitely a spot to visit however if you want to see the homes in the Malibu hills from the end of the pier.Could be a quick visit to see what you want, but shouldn't be disappointing.
Visited on a weekend and it was overly crowded. It wasn't easy to walk without someone bumping into you.

Came for Sunday bfast with friends. Today's line was manageable and we were seated at a nice shaded table with views.I had a pint and the Green Eggs dish. The flavor was unique and enjoyable. It was a little hard to eat as the individual ingredients weren't held together. I'd order it again though!
This is a great place to visit, it has a long history in malibu, there are lots of things to do, there are surfers there that will teach you to surf. and things to rent.
Lots to see, hear and smell! Such a variety of shops, restaurants and great view across the bay. Everyone's happy and enjoying the pier. Great bicycle rides too, going all the way to Venice Beach.

column2: Nice, simple, but nothing prolific. Worth a quick stop though.
column3: There isn't much to see on the pier itself. Construction is happening right now as well. The restaurant at the end of the pier is closed but there's one as you walk onto the pier. Its a shorter pier than, say Huntington Beach. But also less crowded. From here you can view Surfrider beach, where some good breaks happen, as well as the Adamson House, Malibu's FIRST beach house. (One should visit that venue and grounds as well-more to see than the pier.) But for a lazy evening walk or quick respite after dinner from V's across the street, its a nice simple and small pier.
Is always good to be in this magical place where you can have a wonderful time with all your family just a perfect day

column2: yes i have an interesting deal.
column3: yes i would go to malibu pier with shailene woodley and daniel lynch in 6 months in november 2017 for a romantic getaway.

Very quiet compared to the Santa Monica Pier, Malibu Pier is perfect for spending a whole day fishing, reading on a bench or having a lunch while watching the sea or the surfers on the north side of the pier. Malibu Fram , right on the pier, offers smoothies and organic food.
Don't pay to park, you'll be in and out in less than 10 minutes unless you stop at the cafe. There is nothing to see or do on this pier.
Worth an afternoon. Besides the beach there are restaurants, an arcade, rides, and lots of vendors. We did not go on the rides, felt they were pricey, but enjoyed looking around.
Drove out to Malibu from Sherman Oaks. Great drive!Malibu pier area was ok. Not much parking but that's pretty standard for any LA beach area.Lots of surfers in the water.

column2: Not much in the pier. End is under construction.
column3: There is a well reviewed restaurant at the front of the pier but not all that much else. Far end is under construction. If you look off to the north, you can see the surfboarders. Just a few people fishing from the pier,

I had always promised myself that one day that I would go there. This is one of those few times that I kept that promise.Its a nice place to see. The ocean view and the folks there are a pretty good bunch. Parking as is to be expected is $$ and hard to find. But I was just there though for just a few minutes as other duties called.
Malibu pier is small but a nice visit. Check out Venice beach while there. And grab a burger.Fishing on the end of pier. A few rides for the kids and of course souvenirs.

column2: Good views of the north and south beaches
column3: Malibu is a nightmare to park in, but that said, we managed to snap a street parking meter for only $1 an hour on a Sunday!!!! Lots of restaurants and tourist shops around, but the pier is just a short walk to the end and not much else. Lovely views and good people watching. Nothing to go out of your way for!
Not much to see as it is under construction But there is a great restaurant at the entrance to the pier. We had breakfast there and totally loved it.
There are a couple of places to have lunch on pier, medium priced for Malibu. Must pay for parking, no validation. Parking &10. Only a couple of places to browse for souvenirs, most highly priced.

Pier is small. Under construction, we walked up, down and then went over to the beach area. It's dirty and the restrooms are even more gross and disgusting. Parking is very hard and if you have to pay, its very pricy. I will not return.

We took family from out of town to Malibu for lunch and a view of the coastline. The Malibu pier is still under construction at the end but very popular otherwise. At the front is a bustling restaurant and bar and further on are nice benches to sit on and watch the beachgoers and surfers. Beyond those are the local fisherman using the pier fishing poll holders. The whole pier was in great condition and must have been renovated recently.

Took friends visiting from France on a road trip today. Decided to visit the Malibu pier and while there stopped for lunch at the Malibu Farm Restaurant.Parking is $10 in the two lots near the pier. We were lucky to find a spot to park on PCH a couple of blocks south of Nobu's a fine Japanese Restaurant. A ten minute walk got us to the pier where we found the Malibu Farm Cafe at the end of the pier was closed due to being remodeled. It should open in time for the summer tourist season. So we went to the Malibu Farm Restaurant which is at the beginning of the pier.We were pleased to get seated right away even though it was 12:15. We experienced good service and great food. Our friends from France even stated they were pleased with how good the food is the USA.I had the hamburger cooked to perfection. The others in the group enjoyed the chicken sandwich.The stop was a nice break on what ended up being a 150 mile road trip.
Nice to get away from the crowds and stroll along the he beach, the pier is iconic. We walked the the nearby nature reservoir and watched the birds.
The pier is currently under repair at the end but the restaurant portion is open. A nice pier though the lighting at night is a little too bright.

It's a lovely walk along the pier and there are some quirky little items to buy and nice restaurants. My favourite thing here to do was people watch and you might spot a celebrity getting snapped by the paps. On my visit it was Andrew Garfield!

column2: Surfing, Stars and Elegance, Awesome Sun Downs
column3: A visit to the Malibu Pier and the beach is a must. The sunsets are among the best on Highway 1. Watching the surfing line up for an hour itself is fun, then grab food from a few great options on the pier. Continue your drive north and head to Paradise cove, and Zuma next

We walked to the end of the pier and had a nice time looking out at the view. I'm not sure I'd make a special trip to the pier, but if you're nearby and can get a parking spot, check it out. Very nice.

This iconic public pier in Malibu has been refurbished recently. The view is lovely on a clear day, it is a short stroll to the end of the pier and there is a good restaurant located at the end of the pier (Malibu Farm Cafe) & we enjoyed lunch there. There is also a gift shop at the end of the pier (lots of Malibu branded stuff).There is a restaurant at the beginning of the pier (Malibu Pier Restaurant ) but we have no experience dining there. Parking options at the pier are rather limited – you can pay to park in the small lot or on the street.
Must have coffe/brunch ovelooking the sea and the people surfing, coffe and the food are great, come in the morning and during the week because it's beautiful, peacefull and quiet

We came here after we landed in LA airport after a 14 hr flight from Sydney. We hired a car and enjoyed the scenic drive along the coast to Malibu pier. It was a great location to relax in the sun and recover from jet lag. Beautiful cafe sitting up on the roof with amazing views. Would definitely come here again. After we ate we sat in the deck chairs and had an afternoon rest. Very nice.
A fun place to stroll on the boardwalk and watch the fishermen, have lunch and enjoy the ocean. Had a Pelican entertain us by landing and having a fish fed to him by one of the fishermen.
Scenic place to grab breakfast at the end of the pier. Food was good and plentiful. Walk the pier and people watch.
We went out on the pier and had breakfast there. Very nice place with great views of the coastline. Must see

column2: Great restaurant and some views but not much else.
column3: The parking is easy at this pier, but expensive. Plan on $15 during the day and $10 at night. There isn't really anything on the pier except for a very good restaurant, Malibu Farm, and some expensive shops. However, the views are lovely and the local fisherman are interesting to watch.

column2: Beautiful pier in a gorgeous setting
column3: We visited the pier on a showery day recently but despite this the pier maintained its charm amidst a beautiful seaside backdrop
Great place to people watch. Lot's of fisherman. Restaurant at the end of the pier is great for breakfast and lunch.
This is the perfect place for a lazy day.It so relaxed and unassuming but so beautiful at the same time, which makes it a must to visit if you come to LA.

You have got to experience this if you ever make it to the side of California. My husband and I rented a car and we drove the highway up to Malibu just in time to watch the most magnificent sunset... In December people :-) people just parked their motor homes on the side of the highway and camped there. We know what we're planning next year...oh yes

column2: Grab a couple drinks and maybe dinner on the pier
column3: We stopped at the Malibu Pier the other day just to get a look at the sunset. Well the sun was hidden behind some clouds and land so the sunset was not that great. We managed to grab a few drinks and wander down the pier for a spell. Plenty of action on the pier, and what looks like a pretty nice place to eat. Well worth the 45 minutes or so we visited.

I come to the pier to eat whenever I have a visitor from out of town because not only is the food delicious and organic but you get a real feel of being out on the ocean. Admittedly the chairs are awful...plastic and uncomfortable... (the biggest problem), but otherwise it's a great place to eat and especially in the summer when you can sit outside until 9pm. Winter you have to get there before 5 to get any views.So in winter, go for lunch. The food is simple but healthy and you can't beat the view.
Malibu is a beautiful place to visit! Absolutely loved the drive from L.A. Some good little restaurants along the way.

column2: Great little pier with a nice cafe
column3: A very pleasant place to visit. The pier has a coffee shop at the start and a restaurant and the end. Both are very nice although neither did coffee and cake. There is also a great little shop at the end with an old pinball machine which you can play for free

column2: Short pier with restaurants and nice views
column3: We walked over here from Adamson house and surfrider's beach. This is a good area to park and spend half a day with the local attractions. The pier has a couple of restaurants which offer breakfast, lunch and dinner options.We were here on a beautiful, warm November day. There were a lot of people fishing and it was fun to walk up and down the pier. Didn't try any of the restaurants on this visit.

column2: Great spot for pictures, walk and to eat at The Farm Restaurant
column3: Nice place for everyone to enjoy a part of Malibu, take pictures of our amazing sunset and enjoy a great restaurant The Farm

This was a nice stop in the day for us before heading off the airport to return home. The weather was beautiful and we had a walk along before spending some time taking pictures. I had a great time and would love to visit again. We got packing close by and it was an easy walk to the water from there.

column2: Nothing compared to Santa Monica Unfortunately
column3: parking expensive, but Malibu is very expensive. We can park on the PCH but very busy. The restaurant at the edge is nice, with good view on the ocean.

column2: Expensive parking unless you're lucky on the road but really relaxing
column3: Parking was overpriced for the amount of time we were going to spend so dropped a star but we dropped lucky parking on the road and walked back.Just so relaxing. So different to Santa Monica and Pier 39. Walked to the end and managed to grab a wonderful couple of coffees in Malibu Farm Cafe at the end on the right. closed at 4pm but managed to squeeze a good 45 mins just sitting and gazing out to sea as well as people watching with wonderful, relaxing, stereotypical Californian music in the background - and so restful!
As coastal piers go this is nice. Nothing fancy, a good pier for walking and there are some fisherman

Resturant right on the ocean. Sat indoors with a great views of the ocean. Also has seating on the outside on the pier. Food was very good. Had the Humus appetizer and Lemon chicken. Came with sides of beet coucus and creamy potatoes. Friends had Salmon and Paella. Presentation very nice. Very good wine. Barrymore was the wine. Good service. Decor inside cute.

column2: A beautiful spot not to miss when driving by Malibu or Santa Barbara
column3: If you're driving between Santa Barbara and Los Angeles ensure to take the Coastal road and put the Malibu Pier in your GPS.Beautiful drive and stunning clean beaches for a walk, sports, surfing and swimming. Lovely restaurants, cafés and organic juice bars around and on the jetty.Parking is often valet at $10 cash only but avoid that and you'll find plenty of street side parking. Make sure you walk the jetty , enjoy the view and some fresh sea breeze. Perfect place for a light bite or a refreshing drink. You'll also find a very interesting gift shop with interesting toys and surfware.

column2: Surfy...if you drive ten miles further Malibu has a fab white sandy beach and bar X
column3: Awesome views and white sandy beach in MalibuGood for surfers, two great seafood restaurents. Drive further into Malibu you will come across a white sandy beach and hidden bar. Great walk along the beach and amazing sunsets.

We saw several wharfs while we were on a road trip but this was on a much smaller scale and quaint. More personal and friendlier. Make sure you stop, walk to the end and look back at Malibu beach and the famous stilt houses. Nice little coffee shops and restaurants. Recommend
This is as all piers a commercial destination but his one is fun and has saved some of its history. Great views and sunsets were magical.

column2: Beautiful place to catch the sunset
column3: This pier in the center of Malibu has nice shops and restaurants. It is worth a stop for a drink and to watch the surfers or catch the sunset.

We've been to most of the piers in Southern California. I think most of the others are just as good. This does have a restaurant out in the pier and another at the base of the pier but on a summer Saturday the wait foe either was close to two hours. Parking is next to impossible to find. If you are already nearby it is certainly worth a visit but not worth a special trip, unless you are going at an " off " time.

column2: Beautiful spot to enjoy on a nice day
column3: If you want to catch the beach life of Los Angeles this is a great spot with food and drink on the pier and the most famous surf spot in the region adjacent to the pier looking north.

Must stop to truly take in the beauty of Malibu! So much to take in from mountains, the ocean, surfers and locals! It was truly breathtaking! You can park along the highway, grab lunch/ dinner at the pier and walk along the pier or beach!
we wake up early and came here to have breakfast. Service is very nice and prices are average. Food is delicious.

Lovely on a sunny day! Great restaurants, views of the ocean and canyon. Great for fishing as well. Old historic landmark. Walking distance to other restaurants and bars. Parking can be limited and pricey if you need to park across the street when the pier parking is full.
Nice Pier, Nice things to do. We just sat down listened to someone playing the guitar and watch the sea Otters in the ocean

column2: Exciting pier on a beautiful beach
column3: Malibu pier is a sight to see. The beach is beautiful and the pier has a lot of different attractions. There are however loads of people, but it makes for good people watching. I always take my friends from out of town here, it's always a big hit.

This iconic pier is quite short, but you can get lovely views of the surrounding shoreline and the oceans. At both ends, there are cafes run by Malibu Farms, which serve organic and healthy food.At the end of the pier, you can watch fishermen trying their luck, or look at the surfers trying to reach the shore without wiping out.If it is fastfood you want, there is a Jack In The Box across the road from the pier's entrance.
This is a great area. The beaches are clean and the water is great. The pier is great, but gets crowded quickly. Parking can be a problem, but overall this is a place to visit if in Malibu.

column2: Most Beautiful Beach I've Ever Seen
column3: This Beach is the most beautiful beach I've seen.. the waves and the water will calm your spirit in such a way I can't explain..Downside was parking is very hard to find with so many people there.The drive going to the beach if you never seen such a beautiful and colorful place will leave you breathless..The drive was probably 45 miles from the L.A Staples Center I don't remember...Happy Vacationing

A children's paradise from all the rides advisable to buy a band it works out better value than paying for each individual ride the Carousel takes you back in time enjoyable for both young and old the amusement arcade great fun but your dollars disappear at an amazing rate

column2: Nice walk up the beach-clean restroom
column3: we took a stroll down the each after breakfast and took in the pier. An eclectic crowd for a Labor day morning.
Well worth a walk especially before a visit to the Carbon restaurant which is a few minutes walk away. Very well kept and the Malibu farm looked very busy
Malibu is simply gorgeous. The town doesn't have a whole lot to do so the Pier offered something different besides the beach. It's a great place to unwind and relax.

column2: Worth the stop if driving PCH north from LA
column3: Great stop off and visit this iconic location, not a lot there, enough places to eat if you want to. Get down on the beach, dip your toes in the pacific and watch the surfers.

What an amazing experience. We came all the way from downtown LA and it was worth it!! Highly recommended. The views are to die for!! The colours and relaxed atmosphere are priceless. Just disppointed by very very pricy shopping and very limited local eating options

You simply cannot go to LA without seeing the Malibu Pier. I would get there early, at least on a weekend, because parking can be at a premium. There is a lot right there, but it is not very big. Expect to pay, too, it's not free. You might also find parking alone the highway.We enjoyed going onto the pier and taking pictures of the beautiful ocean and looking back at the awesome homes on the hills. Most people are willing to take your family's picture and it's always nice to return the favor.At the end of the pier is the Malibu Farm Cafe. It's a nice, casual dining spot with some healthy options. You don't need to spend a whole afternoon here, just an hour or so will do, depending on if you decide to eat.

column2: Pacific Coast Highway is a beautiful drive
column3: While in the Los Angeles area waiting for a wedding reception my wife and I drove the Pacific Highway for Highway 27 up through Malibu, saw the pier, beach and shops along the way. Very beautiful drive, a lot of people but surprisingly the beaches were not as crowded as I thought. It was well worth the drive.

The lovely waters of the Pacific Ocean! Get an open tour bus from Santa Monica tour and drive down to Malibu passing houses of famous celebrities like Arnold Schwarzenegger, Leonard dicaprio, Mathew Perry, etc. It's just an experience.

column2: Not a bad place to visit for the afternoon.
column3: Gets really busy later in the afternoon, but generally a safe and pleasant way to spend the afternoon in the 'Bu!Not much to do other than watch the surfers, eat or just enjoy a beer at Malibu farm (either end of the pier)

column2: Great Pier and the walk to it
column3: Park at Malibu McDonalds (not sure how long you can stay for, we where on vacation and don't care), walk along the front it takes about 10 minutes. Pleasant Malibu walk (Nobu restaurant looks nice) and then spend a bit of time on the beach and pier well worth it, but I prefer Santa Barbara pier.

We visited just before dinnertime hoping to find something to do - Enjoyed walking the length of the pier and enjoying dinner at the Malibu Farm The gift shop at the end of the pier is worth the trip - filled with loads of cute stuff.

column2: If You Don't Visit the Malibu Pier Then You Missed The Best of Cali
column3: The Malibu Pier is synonomous with big Hollywood stars, glamour, surfing and Bay Watch. If you drive Highway 1 and don't go here why would you drive HWY 1 in the first place. In other words this is a MUST DO. My wife and I went to the pier for lunch a few years ago and we looked out the restaurant and Arnold The Governator was looking back at us. Pretty cool.

column2: Pier and beach are just a great local!
column3: The beach was great that day, the parking - which a problem normally in that area- was easy and reasonable ($8) right on the beach side. There are showers, toilets, great golden sand , swimming and surfing area. Too bad the life guard did not allow buggie boarding in the surfing area, where the waves were. The crowd was mixed between some locals and tourists. Watch out for the Seaguls, as they will steal your food very quickly without you knowing. The back drop of Malibu pier is great and photographic. And don't forget the view of the hills as the landscape decorated with beautiful homes and some mansions. Walk under the pier as the view changes with the time of the day and the sun coming through. There are few restaurants and fast food close by, there a cafe on the pier top floor and a store for some souvenirs . You also can see across the ocean to Santa Monica and byoned .

column2: ocean view? check. dining? check. hassle parking? check,
column3: there are a few okay restaurants on the pier but the view is lovely, parking is a hassle and very expensive if you are lucky enough to nab a space on the street good luck. if you can put all that aside you and need a beach view, it's fine.

column2: Great views, nice restaurants, beautiful pier but terrible parking and environs
column3: I hated going to this pier as the parking was so bad and this part of PCH is really not the prettiest one. So no points for all this. But the actual pier is really pretty and we absolutely loved the restaurant and the shop in the end of it, so average points sum up to three as I would give five points to the pier alone.
Were staying close by and took several walks down the pier. Good for fishing and just relaxing. Very peaceful.

column2: Historic Pier. Good Food. Great Views
column3: You don't have to eat here, but I suggest that you do. Food is very good and reasonably priced for the location. Spend some time just enjoying the view

The Malibu pier is a waste of your time. If you want a cool breeze and a nice vibe with a couple drinks, go for it. Bring a sweatshirt even in the summer. But it's not a good place to eat dinner considering the myriad options available. You'll pay $10 or $15 to park, walk a couple hundred feet, and discover the options are limited to swanky organic overpriced garbage.

We went here with our two teenage daughters after a day on the beach. Lots of things to see and do - some live entertainment and lots of food. Restaurants were also there too (Bubba Gump being one of them.)

column2: A great place to people watch
column3: A smashing place to chill and people watch and enjoy a nice cool drink or three.Although it seemed like a lifetime to find a parking spot the wait in the end was worth it.what made our visit to the pier a little more interesting was the fact that there was some filming of some documentary or other.The beach is also a cool place to hang out.

column2: Bus it, it's cheaper than parking
column3: We took the 534 from Santa Monica, traffic is traffic whether you're in a bus or car. The pier is pretty, we didn't eat. You can fish, but there are game wardens, so learn the rules. Beach is ok, although we seemed to be there on a sea slug day. Water is cool. Not many amenities. There's a lady selling water and chips near the small beach.
Love going here it is close and beautiful view. Anytime is nice evening or day. always breezy. There is a fee for parking.

column2: 30 mins 5 dollars worth the stop and walk
column3: a beautiful day to walk out on the ocean and look back at the coast. Just beautiful. park in the lot for 5 dollars for 30 minutes. just enough time to walk to the end and back and take a few pictures.
Definitely worth the drive up to this charming pier. Catch a casual lunch on the end of the pier and enjoy a little shopping too. Great getaway from busy LA.

column2: A nice stop along the way
column3: Several enticing opportunities for coffee, lunch or dinner.California style at its best, here with appealing Scandinavian touch.As a spice of everything is the most divine shop at the far end of the pier

column2: Farm to table on the pier!
column3: A great little restaurant on the pier, so the scenery is outstanding. I also loved the atmosphere, and the noise level outside was quite wonderful. It is farm-to-table, so everything is fresh! I loved it, and would have happily eaten here my whole time in Malibu!

column2: When in Rome, or Malibu as the case may be ...
column3: Nothing special about Malibu Pier but if you're there and parking is available, it's worth a stop and the walk.

I visited the Malibu pier yesterday and parked in the lot adjacent to it. Well aware of the $5/30-minute charge, I made sure to exit well ahead of my 1st thirty minutes expiring. My ticket had me clocking in at 10:48; I got to the exit at 11:09 - which was the time punched by attendant...21 minutes in my calculations. The parking attendant tried to charge me $10, saying I went was into my 2nd 30-minutes (he even had a calculator!). I told him "no" - I still had plenty of time remaining. He continued to argue w/me, insisting I needed to return to the attendant at the entry gate to argue my case. Wasn't going to do that because I knew they were scamming me. He refused to take my payment...and since he wouldn't take my $5 payment, I had to drop it out my window so that I could leave. These guys were out to make extra $$$...watch 'em!

column2: A lovely coastal drive to get here
column3: Did it more to bring back memories - I used to enjoy the drive on the Pacific Coast Highway from Santa Monica and loved the ocean views and the canyons as backdrops - had a favourite restaurant called Granita but its probably years since it was there. The pier seemed a thing to do, probably like any other pier but did enjoy the ocean and sunsets.

column2: Checked it out, and checked the list, no need to go back
column3: It is what it is. Gotta check it out once. But $12 to park and not really much to see. We happened to go while the amusement park was closed for a private event, your mileage may vary. Otherwise, Bubba Gump is everywhere (on the plus side, pretty predictable). On to the rest of the tourist compulsories...

column2: So many piers, so little time
column3: This is a lovely pier, one should stop unless one has already seen the other innumerable piers along the PAC. It's not particularly special, but it is on the Pacific Ocean, and worth stopping if you're visiting the area on a sunny day.

Nice drive from Los Angeles. Do remember that it shows short distance in the map but if it's rush hours it might take even 1,5 hrs to drive it. Very cozy place and beautiful pier. Try the Farm House restaurant when You are there.

Very pleasant walk - was a bit breezy and chilly - we weren't prepared for that. Nice to watch the local surfers from here. There were plenty of fishers. The pier was clean and friendly staff. Bathrooms were available

column2: Very cute and also great family fun
column3: The Malibu pier is a great free place to grab a bite to eat. There is very easy free parking across the street as well as a pay lot right in front.The Malibu Farms restaurant serves amazingly fresh, local and organic California cuisine for breakfast on the weekends and also lunch and dinner.Try the cauliflower crust pizza! It's amazing and has no actual bread.
Its a nice large extense pier, where you may just go for the sunset or for fishing, just a realxing place to hang out.

Charming wooden pier,few cafes and gift shops along at the end,peaceful and serene,except for the fact ,that when we visited,April '16,it was undergoing renovation work to replace its wooden stilts that it stands on.

column2: Taken whale watching trip from here. Simple pier.
column3: If you just want a stroll on a pier this is it. If you are looking to entertain children you are best heading down to the Santa Monica Pier.
This is just another pier along the Pacific Coast Highway. Not worth for a special trip to go there, besides parking is always a problem.

column2: Yes yes yes: views, peaceful and serene
column3: Yes its iconic. So glad the state saved it and finally reopened after the late 90's el nino. (no damage from the weak 2015-2016 el nino).Yes it's open during construction. Construction is to replace pilings weakened and lost during storm surf 2 summers ago.Yes, you get some of the best views of surfrider and surfers from here.Yes, it's peaceful and totally different from the crowded-noisy Santa Monica pier.Yes, both restaurants are tasty and reasonably priced.Yes, parking can be really challenging on weekends. I Suggest weekdays!Yes yes yes
Peaceful and full of life all at the same time depending on where you are sitting and looking. great people watching

As I have seen Malbu a lot on T.V. over the years I thought while in L.A. why not drive up and have a look. It is beautiful, tons of traffic and a lot of bike riders need to keep your eyes out for them on the highway. As I stated very beautiful, hard to find parking but a must see.
Loved Malibu! It's such an iconic place and it was wonderful to drive past all the big beach houses... Weather was fabulous and so was lunch and the beach!

We visited here on a Saturday afternoon and it was amazing, a few little cafes line the start of the pier and a few fast food places along Ocean Way so lots of choice. The pier is lovely and you can walk right to the end to another cafe/restrooms/gift shop with souvenirs etc. You can watch the surfers down on the beach and there's plenty benches along the beach to soak up the Rays although it can get a little windy. Overall it's a great place for walk and I think it would be magical especially at sunset!!
Quiet nice place. really pleasant to walk through. we had a coffe and hot chocolate at Malibu Farm, they place is great and has a nice view!!!
The Malibu Pier has on of the best restaurants to habe breakfast in the area, Malibu Farm. Organic with unique taste and unbeatable bloody mary's! Highly recommnedable.

Surprising quiet on a Sunday morning. Crane in the middle of the pier but you can get past. Nice views with a organic cafe at both ends of pier. Only had a cappuccino and a chai latte expensive at $14 but good

The pier is very nice. It was under construction when I went so there was a large crane on it but I could still walk out to the end. There is a nice restaurant and shop, both of which are very expensive but nice. Great views.

column2: Good stop to start your vacation through the West Coast!
column3: First stop to learn of your surroundings and start your cruising through the west coast shore. The pier has great views and awesome restaurant "Malibu Farm", a not-to-miss-spot"
Great place to walk out into ocean and Malibu tide. Plenty to do and always different things to see. Great people to watch and talk with. Fun time.
Under construction but you can still go out to the end. It is so pretty, a great spot to watch surfers and get a feel for the California Groove
The Malibu Pier is a beautiful place , but is not touristic because of its residential life.It's a place for rich people.There are wonderful houses.

column2: Wooden pier with a great restaurant
column3: We found this place while meandering down the coast after a meeting a lovely rickety old pier with an out of this world restaurant serving local food.

Good place to hang out after the Getty Villa closes and you're doomed by the traffic and you bring up Google Maps and it's a red pin cushion.There are two Malibu Farms locations here, one close to the road (which seems to be inhabited by tragically hip locals) and one at the end of the pier with very friendly locals and internationals. We went to the end and had really good burgers and seafood and watched the sun go down both literally and on our hopes of getting back to our place before 10 p.m. People were fishing for mackerel from the pier and having really good luck.The pier combines some of the best things about California -- good food, great nature, and a low-key ride.

They are in the process of repairing the pier so it wasn't as picturesque as I had planned with a big crane parked on the pier. A little pricey for what it is. Maybe wait until after the renovations are done?
Visit Malibu Cafe to get $39.00 off the parking ticket. We arrived about 9:30 am on a Monday and had the entire beach and pier to ourselves. We saw otters, dolfins, and many birds.

column2: You can see for miles and miles
column3: We pulled in and parked at the Malibu Pier's parking lot. It cost $10 but we planned on checking out the pier and the nearby beaches.There is Malibu Farms restaurant at the beginning of the pier that has indoor and outdoor seating with views of the beach and the ocean.At the end of the pier there is the Malibu Farms cafe and a nice gift shop.The end of the pier was a great spot to gaze out over the ocean on this calm, warm, sunny day. There were seagulls and Pelicans flying and people surfing and paddle boarding.The views are amazing.This was a great way to spend an hour before heading out to explore the nearby beaches.

The pier itself is nothing special, especially with so many other things to do in Malibu, but it does play host to Malibu Farm, a wonderful spot to have breakfast or lunch before setting off on a canyon hike. There are two locations at the start and end of the pier, both serving the same menu. Grab a seat outside to take in the coastal views amid sounds of the waves on shore.Food is well prepared farm-to-table cuisine. We'd highly recommend the Lobster Breakfast Burrito and the breakfast pizza looked very interesting, too.Once you've eaten too much, head up to any one of the parks or nearby Getty Villa for a long stroll.
Malibu has the best views! The pier is fun and a great experience while in Malibu. Parking can be hard to find but its worth the trip! The photography is amazing at sunset.

Definitely spectacular regarding view and scenery but not to go there if you're hungry or want to do more than just walk. Honestly I prefer Santa Monica Pier but surely is a place to see once in a lifetime.

The best part of the pier is the view of the surfers off the point. Lots of ,anglers on the pier and watching them catch salt water fish is fun and educational. particularly for a fresh water angler. Parking in this area was limited.

Stopped on the PCH to view the historic pier. Restaurants at either end looked delicious and used local ingredients. No prices shown on interior blackboard menus that I could see so put off. Pretty sea views and views back to coast. Worth stopping for.

A very low key stroll on the smaller pier. Parking is $10. There is a site that rents fishing poles but the restaurant out on the end closes at 4:00 pm do i would get there before that for the best view. Malibu farm restaurant at the base of the pier is open later and is wonderful.

It has a great pacific ocean view and some "Santa Monica" park's mountains. It is not as Santa Monicas pier neither has that many thigs to do! If you are looking for ocean water and a view it is the place.

It's Malibu. It's the pier. It's on Santa Monica Bay in the Pacific Ocean. It's served as the site for many films. Once you get there you'll recognize it from one of your favorites.
