Come hungry for lunch and eat at one of the restaurants on the pier. My burger was beyond excellent A bit pricey for a burger, but worth it for the experience. And the drive to and from is magnificent

We went on December 31 during the day. It was so clear, the weather was amazing. We ate at the Malibu Farms which was delicious. Had cauliflower pizza that was fantastic. Great bloody Mary's. Beautiful views of the ocean

This pier is not very huge- small and nice. I preferred to visit this pier as I live pretty close from here. Reaching and getting away from traffic on Pacific coastal highway takes time. It has one or two coffee shops - restaurants on the pier which seemed utterly busy on weekend - I went on Saturday. The one at the entrance looks fancy and love to try that on my next visit.

column2: Park outside. Its a small pier
column3: Reviewing only the pier and nothing else...The only thing good about it is the 2 restaurants there. The cafe at the entry and the restaurant at the end. Very pretty.But other than those 2, its just a pier.But the view is amazing. Theres lots of fishing pole hooks. Theres parking on the road. Rental kayaks nearby.

This pier is in the heart of old Malibu, a short walking distance from historic Adamson House. Malibu Colony, and Malibu Lagoon State Park are also close by. There are two dining areas for the restaurant, Malibu Farm, one at each end of the pier. Indoor and al fresco tables are available. The seaward side dining is usually more crowded, but the landward end is warmer and less windy. There is scant parking along the Pacific Coast Highway, so if you go on a weekend for brunch, parking might be difficult. Early breakfast at Malibu Farm is the best time to avoid crowds. By 10 am seating and parking are almost full.

Great place to stop during a Sunday drive up the coast. When you enter the pier there is a great restaurant flanking both sides of the walk way. As you walk down the long board walk people stand all the railings fishing. At the end of the pier is another restaurant facing the ocean. This is a good spot the catch the sun set.

column2: I got a chance to read a book on the beaches of malibu!
column3: Im a avid reader and this was a bucket list place to just experience it. I felt like I was in an episode of moesha as we rode along th epier! lol

There are better views from dozens of other piers up and down the coast, parking is nearly impossible and is expensive, there are no bathrooms except for a filthy port-o-potty or if you are a restaurant patron they'll give you the key to their bathroom, and if you dare to walk near the road you'll be targeted by crazy motorists or aggressive bicyclist packs. The only thing worth doing here is watching the action at Surfrider Beach. For a better view and more interesting surroundings take a ride through nearby Pepperdine University and drive to the top of campus.

We went there on a cloudy day so we couldn´t take full advantage of the views because was kind of foggy, but it´s really pretty in spite of it all... and it has benches so you can sit and drink your warm latte!

column2: A must to visit if in the Malibu area
column3: Whether a sunny day or cool, dark evening, the pier has so much to offer in the way of views, sounds, food and fun. Watching the locals fish, viewing the twinkling lights up in the mountains at night, feasting on delicious foods at Malibu Farm, or viewing the memorabilia (Gidget!) in the gift shop, it is time well-spent here.

column2: A Malibu landmark and worth a visit.
column3: Has a great view of the coastline, and I used to go fishing there when I was younger. Free and a fun place to visit.
A café and a restaurant - great view and nice wind. We were unlucky with high water, but beaches is near.
Had a great drive from Santa Monica up to Malibu and then back to Malibu Pier, great views and great location made it a worthwhile trip especially in a convertable mustang!

We did not eat at the restaurant - so our 'experience' is quite limited -- because, other than we did take advantage of one of the benches to enjoy the sun and the breeze, there isn't much else to review!

Nice views, but didn't rate the restaurant as previously reviewed. Park the car up (on the street if you can to save $s) and wander down to the and then onto it. Nice watching the water sports happening. I'd imagined lots of surf, but certainly the day we visited that wasn't the case.
This pier has amazing restaurants. Great for brunch and the views are amazing. Parking is easy with the valet and the view is spectacular. We had an amazing breakfast.

column2: Nice break in the pacific coast drive
column3: My husband and I stopped here during our drive up the pacific coast. There is some street parking, otherwise you have to pay $10 to park in the lot. It's a nice place to stop, take pictures and go to the Malibu Farm or restaurant. There is also a little shop at the end of the pier.

One of a very good places to visit in LA. Take a drive on Malibu road towards SF for few miles in the evening and stop at this place for nice sunset view. Should be chosen over Santa Monica if you are confused between these 2 places.

column2: Great place for a gorgeous view!
column3: I highly recommend visiting Malibu and its gorgeous views. Its no Florida beaches thats for sure, but it does carry its own theme and feeling. We drove through here and stopped at a few spots to take pictures, I highly recommend checking it out!

We enjoyed our visit to the pier. Finding a parking space was a challenge. Luckily we don't mind walking. There wasn't anything spectacular about it but since we had seen the pier in several tv shows and movies we put it on our list of things to see/do while on our Pacific Coast Highway road trip and LA stay.

Excellent place to stop to view the ocean and people watch. Much quieter and more relaxed than Santa Monica Pier. Parking is located close by ($10 I think) if you can not get a space on the road. Beautiful spot.

Much quieter and laid back than the Santa Monica Pier which is an absolute zoo. Wonderful place to take a stroll, sit and look at the ocean, beach, birds. There is a nice shop near the end with high quality T-shirt gifts plus a laid back farm restaurant at the end of the pier. We actually ate lunch outside at the restaurant on the beach end of the pier-- with divine views-- but heard it has since closed.
This is a chilling area to be. Not so busy and the beachesare short and sweet. Plenty of surfers to gaze at just around the bay!
The view of the sun setting in the sea from this point is sheer magical.The light is beautiful. A very serene landscape to enjoy.

Views are excellent and while there you should eat at Paradise Cove Cafe ... the specialty drinks are amazing and the food is delicious. A bit more than a mid range price but a lot of food for the money. Definitely worth a visit.

If you want to walk along a pier, watch fisherman and have a great meal, Malibu Pier has it all. The Farm and Casa Escobar are both easy walking distance from the pier and the bast part of all is watching the surfers at Malibu Surfrider Beach vying for waves. Stand up paddle boards and kayaks are available to rent at nearby surf shops. On a warm sunny day, it is gorgeous!

column2: One of the better piers to visit in Southern California
column3: Not nearly as big, touristy or as kitschy as Santa Monica -- and therefore much more accessible. Great view of Surfrider Beach.

I lovely place to go solo or with family or friends. Beautiful place to swim or just walk the pier and take in the sights. My daughter and I are movie fiends so we "attempted" to recreates scenes from the X-Files in August 2014 as well as the movie, "The Net" that were shot on location there. Had a ball!! Plus the little restaurant that boasts "the end of Route 66" has great food!!! If you're in Santa Monica, take the time to just walk and enjoy the Pier!! And oh yes! You can't forget that Sharknado was filmed there too!! Be ever watchful for those pesky flying sharks!!
There's really not a whole lot to say about the pier alone. Malibu, however, is a great community to go people watching and visiting nearby local sights and restaurants.

Just a pier with great views and dinning, no attractions, rides, etc. Had lunch at the pier very expensive $13 for a BLT sandwich, but the bacon was maybe the best bacon I have ever had, from an organic restaurant. Look to the North side of the of pier and you can just hear the theme song from Two and a Half Men television show.
Beautiful views and a great beach. Picnic, drive, jog, walk. Must visit for everyone once in your life

column2: If you've never been it's a nice stop in the Bu!
column3: Things I love about Malibu pier… It's so Malibu!!! At the end of the pier you have a nice little gift shop with all the Malibu local clothing items and other trinkets for sale. Across from that you can grab a bite or fresh juice from Malibu Farms… I don't think the food is the best but it's not that either. Either way it makes for a very special experience as it truly is farm fresh food. It's see yourself at the restaurant so you can get a nice view of the paddle borders and surfers and a great view of the infamous Malibu pier!Parking can be a bit of a nightmare depending on what time you arrive. They do have self parking/self paid parking but that lot fills up quickly they have a spillover light is well… Again that particular area can be a bit traffic jammed depending on whether you're coming on the weekend or a holiday. Directly across the street there's also a few restaurants if you don't feel like eating on the pier. There are also plenty of paddle boarding, surfing, and wetsuit rental shops nearby!
NIce view, and a traditional sight for any LA visitor. It may be too crowded sometimes, but it is worth seeing at least once.

Enjoying the cool breeze while standing on the pier was enchanting. The smell of the ocean filled the breeze as the tide moved in and out on the shore, challenging the surfers that were trying to ride the waves. The shops on the pier offered beach themed collectors items and clothing; and the food was very tasty (and organic). The view could be enjoyed from inside the cafe, or outside on first or second level seating. While I stood on the pier, my family enjoyed running in and out of the water along the shoreline. This experience was definitely an enjoyable one.
Great restaurant on the end of the pier. A bit pricey but this is Malibu! Nice walk out on the pier and can watch the surfers...dolphins...seagulls and possibly sea lions too.

column2: Awesome Wood Pier with a Gift Shop & Restaurant at the End
column3: This is a really cool wooden pier that is fun to walk and people watch. The end of the pier has a very cool little store and a great restaurant.

The views are amazing. Arrived quite early in the day so managed to park flies to the pier. Spent a couple of hours here. Had a coffee at the cafe on the end of the pier and did'nt do anything at all. Just sat and watched. Watched the sea, the birds, the waves, the surfers and the people. Lovely way to spend a morning.
The Market Farm is just great - cannot recommend it highly enough. Food is well made, with fresh ingridiens and served by friendly skilled personell. And the views? Fantastic from every seat
It's a pier. It's the polar opposite of the Santa Monica zoo-pier. Not much to do or see, $7.50 for an hour parking.Let's go with "serene."

Oh my! my love for the Malibu pier is unconditional! I always have an amazing time when I visit this place! Talk about peer serenity and peace! The water is so Amazing! I'm never usually a fan of getting in the Pacific Ocean lol because it's always so cold but this beach just makes me want to jump in! The energy is always so nice and chill and the people that work at the restaurants are always very professional and welcoming! Sometimes people have that feeling that you will get that snooty kind of attitude because it's Malibu..although that may be the case in some spots I've yet to experience it! The traffic is beyond nuts but it's worth it all in the end!
Nice pier with lots of fun things to see and do. Malibu is a nice little town. Don't miss this when in Cali
I was there nice place kind of moody and calm .... nice to c surfers doing there thing its well organized .. and when I was done tanning I ate jack in the box

we did a long PCH1 drive. along the route we passed thru Malibu. figured we'd stop and see the fisherman on the Pier. not too much to rave about. there is restaurant. this is a 1/2 hr stop if you're just there to Pier tour. oh, yes ocean view... lol

The pier is a nice stop along PCH. You can see an excellent views the Malibu coast. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. A lot of celebraties live along the coast , rows of small homes or cottges surround it.
Beautiful place to visit. Had dinner at Malibu Farm Restaurant on the pier and the food was excellent. Very scenic with house in the hills overlooking the ocean. Great place to visit.

column2: It's a Pier, but it's Malibu
column3: If you are driving through Malibu, it's probably worth a stop to take a look and a walk around, but I would not make a special trip. It's a small pier with a bar/restaurant and, of course, the ocean view. You'll see some folks fishing off the pier and maybe some surfers along the beach. At the time we were there, Coors was filming a commercial in the bar area of the patio. That was kind of cool to watch.

Where do I start? The weather was perfect and watching the surfers was really cool. This is a perfect place to stop off, stretch your legs, catch some rays, and get some free entertainment, (surfers). I have personally never surfed before, but it looked like so much fun. My husband and I witnessed a young girl, maybe about 16 years old, attempt the waves on a paddle board for her first time, that was interesting. I wanted to try it as well but we were heading up the coast to San Francisco at the time and only stopped off to watch some surfers before continuing on our way. Not sure everyone is interesting surfing but we enjoyed it! The air was warm but the water was cold while we were there, ( mid-June). I would definitely recommend stopping here for a small break while traveling, sunning, watching surfer's battle the waves or actually taking a paddle board lesson yourself. It was a nice relaxing time!
Nothing better than sitting with a ocean view and gulping your cold beer. The place offers a good view along with few restaurants. Must visit if you visit Malibu..!!

column2: Pier is Pretty Good for what it is ...
column3: This is the Classic pier seen in the movies. It is pretty simply the pier without much trimmings of extras. There's the restaurant on the end & guys are fishing off of the pier sides. No arcades of merry-go-rounds here, just the Pier seen in 'Chinatown' & 'Devil in a Blue Dress' & many other movies. Enjoy it for the views and what it is...

Based on some review books we read, we thought we would spend half a day in Malibu and some of our time at the Malibu Pier. What a surprise it was for us to learn that there is very little to do at the Pier. When we finally found parking in Malibu, we spent about a half hour on the pier. Save your time and head to Santa Barbara or San Luis Obispo.

Malibu was a hideaway along Pacific Coast Highway when it was a winding, narrow roadway north of Santa Monica,The pier is its most iconic landmark with its twin end buildings. A short stroll along it brings one to the end with a great view on a clear day of Santa Catalina Island 26 miles at sea.One can imagine one of the stars of the Silver Screen during Hollywood's Golden Age looking out into the ocean, maybe watching rouge gambling ship skirting the authorities.
Our family enjoyed walking the pier and the views while traveling through Malibu recently. We paid to park in the lot beside the pier entrance for its convenience.

column2: Beautiful for watching the sunset, the surfers or having a meal
column3: First of all, understand that this is not Santa Monica. Malibu is somewhat sleepy with a handful of shops, some good restaurants but most miles of gorgeous beaches. If you need entertainment this probably isn't a good choice but if you are looking for a great view and a stroll, this is an excellent choice.

This is an amazing pier with great views, restaurants and activities. There are many looking for a fish to bit, many there to eat and many to look around. The surfers are all around and inbuilt entertainment.

column2: Nice stroll over the water and free access
column3: Parking on the street is free yet local businesses gouge tourists for $10 to $30 forparking in their lots. There is a Jack in the Box directly across the street if you want cheap eats.
Go to watch the surfers. The weather is great; but the water is freezing ! Great for people watching.

Lovely picturesque pier that is quiet compared to the nearby Santa Monica Pier. Really there is nothing to do except look at the scenery and fish....the restaurant is not always open...and so there are not many options for dining.

I had high hopes for Malibu... I was really excited to take the drive up from Santa Monica to check it out ... and when we got there? Literally there's nothing but a small pier, who's restaurant was closed, which left a small tourist shop. Surprisingly disappointing.

Malibu Pier was a lovely place to go for a relaxing walk. Compared to Santa Monica pier, we found it quite quiet, with just a few restaurants and shops. Lots of fishermen trying to catch their dinner. From the pier you can see right down the coastline,with lots of multi-million dollar beach homes perched on the edge of the sandy cliffs. Just stop and gaze out at the ocean, with unobstructed views. The organic farm at the end was pretty busy so we just had a drink. Lovely location. Lovely way to spend a few hours! Easy parking on the road...possible short walk.
It's a beautiful beach with calm waves and great spot to just lay down and get tanned. Easy to park as well. Not many restaurants options, though.

This is a lovely long pier. Nice to stroll late afternoon and watch the sunset. If you want the Pier in your photo, I recommend standing down by the Malibu Beach Inn which isn't far and get your photos there. You will get the water lapping on the shore, the pier and the sunset all in your photo. We stood ON the pier at sunset and then walked back to the Malibu Beach Inn carpark for more photos. There is a restaurant and I think shops on this pier, but we didn't investigate. The scenery and view from the pier along the coast is beautiful.
amazing time here food was to die for sevice and drinks was amazing just all round great time.I recomend having a sandwich and a bottle of theire finest wine as it was really good..

column2: I was looking forward to the organic food at Malibu Farm but...
column3: Malibu Farm restaurant looked like a good choice for our late lunch in Malibu after checking into our AirBnB, but when we arrived we were told only outdoor tables were available for unreserved tables. No problem, we thought and proceeded outside only to be told by yet another employee that we had to go upstairs to the upper deck to find a table. We did that and just as we sat down, another employee told us we had to move. By this time we decided we were not really welcome there and left. The good news is the restaurant at the other end of the pier, nearer the PCH, was welcoming and gave us a lovely table near the surf. They even turned on the outdoor heater when the wind blew up and offered me a blanket to wrap around my shoulders. The staff could not have been more gracious. We were told later that the same owner has both restaurants. Food was excellent. We went back with a large family party the next day for brunch and had a similar experience.

column2: Good to walk and check out the shops
column3: The pier is nice for a stroll and has some nice shops down at the end. The view is good and you can watch some people catching waves at Malibu Beach.Free parking is a little hard to find close to the pier, but if you don't mind a bit of a walk you can get parking up the street.There is a restaurant at the end but we didn't eat there, so I can't comment on it.
It's lovely, especially viewed from the ocean. The entire Pacific Coast is a sight no American should miss, given the opportunity!

column2: Enjoyed lunch on the pier watching the surfers
column3: Charming pier with a great restaurant "Malibu farm" at the end of it with great, healthy food. We sat outside and watched the surfers and view of the coast. There is a nice gift shop there as well.

There are much better view of the coast and of sunsets than going to this pier. For example, go to Pepperdine University campus, that is open to the public, for the sunset. It is not very far from the Malibu pier.
Loved the outside view of the ocean. Food was for sure a plus. Need to get there early. long lines for fresh seafood for lunch.I had the shrimp with fries and was plenty and very tasty

had a great great relaxing lunch on the malibu pier watching the pelicans and surfers. Their are 2 restaurants , I ate at the one at the end , malibu farm ? All organic food and delicious. Staff was very friendly . you order at the counter, take a number and they bring the food to you. there is no rush and it is a nice relaxing spot. Small shop nx door with some high end souvenirs. the restaurant in the beginning of the pier looked a little pricy and wasn't open for "brunch". It was exactly what i was looking for

Nice souvenir shop across from an incredible restaurant (Malibu Farm Cafe) that serves food from 3 local Malibu organic farms. Delicious & with an amazing view of Surfrider Beach & beyond. Try to park free on Pacific Coast Hwy otherwise paid parking by the entrance to the pier.

One of the few places in Malibu you can park for free along the kerb and access great views of Malibu the beach and homes right on the shore. You can hire fishing gear at the end of the pier in a really nice gift shop has some really nice inexpensive items clothes toys and Malibu souvenirs. The pier is really clean and well maintained just nice to walk along and grab a meal. Access to the pier is also free. Worth the drive
I loved strolling on and near this historic landmark. It is surrounded by many great little side day trips and plenty of fine eateries. At high tide the waves are gorgeous to view.
very quiet, very clean, not too busy or crazy crowded. just walk around and enjoy the view. love it here
Not a great pier in terms off thing to do but the views out into the ocean are worth stopping for.Different all together to Santa Monica pier.

Calm and nice place to sit an enjoy a crispy and beautiful morning. Watch the surfers waiting for the perfect wave and have some lunch at the very popular restaurant at the end of the pier - Malibu Farm.

There is not much to do on the pier but there is two restaurants and lots of beautiful views of the ocean all around. Nice place to take family to walk around and enjoy the views of the ocean and the sounds of the waves.

column2: not much there, but pretty views
column3: not a lot to do on or near the Malibu pier, but the views are wonderful. parking can be expensive and hard to find.

The Malibu pier is nice, it has a great view, but the beach was not that exciting, when we got to the beach next to the pier we wanted to get into the sea but there was a warning sign that said the sea was contaminated and swimming was banned, at least you were surfing. So we wanted to rent some surfboards and we could find anywhere to rent them.

column2: Excellent lunch restaurant at the end of the pier
column3: Perfect spot for an organic but delicious lunch. Great food, staff and wonderful view! Also a top spot to enjoy a drink in the sun. Highly recommended!

column2: nice location but not like Santa Monica Pier
column3: If you're looking for a lot of activity, go to Santa Monica & not Malibu. However, if you want a nice quite place & like to walk the pier, I recommend this pier. Be prepared to spend some money for parking & food while there. Both are a little pricey.

quite clean crowd free....as the sun goes down the sharks come in to feed.Spent many a night and day fishing this great pier.....usually no body else was therebut it was January to May (best time to visit) shark fishing was great (catch and release only)you just have to watch your hand as they like to turn around and bite your for arm....it does hurt.too bad it's not far enough north for the water to sparkle in that blue ocean way.....here it is still muddy.....in fact all the way to Oxnard.....the pier by Hurst mansion and Santa Barbara pierare by far the best....don't even ask me about Santa Monica pier or the board walk.

The trip from LA to Malibu is very nice, do expect traffic as you head toward Malibu as there was road construction in Oct. 2014. Once you arrive at Malibu Pier, expect a very laid back stroll. It is beautiful and low key, especially compared to Santa Monica Pier. You can have a nice lunch on the pier, or maybe an ice cream cone. You have to pay to park and walk a bit, but it is a pleasant little pier. Don't expect much if you are looking for excitement.
Just to stand on the pier and gaze out to sea was brilliant. We did this on our last day in CA and watched surfers and swimmers and wished like anything that we could stay longer. Simple gifts
Not as many shops as I thought it would have. Nice to have a little walk and to grab something to eat.

This is a great place to view the ocean and enjoy the fresh breeze. Didn't eat at the restaurant but will the next time around, the gift shop at the end is really cool and the custom made surfboards made us want to hit the water.

this is a great place to visit it is more like a place on a stick!!!! it over looks the pacific ocean and its loaded with nice stuff you can fish or just chill but don't forget to look back at the coastline! its magical....
Had brunch with my daughter at this charming, unpretentious and delicious place. Food is simple, affordable and easy!

column2: The One Place for The Best Coastal View from the Beach Area
column3: Visiting the pier is a great, basically free, way to visit Malibu. You can see the beautiful views, look down in the water, watch the fisherman, and maybe see a seal. There are at least 2 restaurants on the pier and several accross the street, if you want to catch a meal. You can park along the road for free or pay $10.00 to park right next to the pier. Additional public beaches and parks are nearby. Enjoy!!

We drove through Malibu 27 miles looking for the rich and famous, didnt see anyone but it was a lovely drive. Make sure you stop and walk onto the beaches to look back at the beach houses, they are amazing. Sat on the Pier watching the sun set watching the local surf, a memory that I will never forget, it was so peaceful. Entrance to the pier is free and it is worth walking to the very end and set and relax.

column2: Part of the surfing world history
column3: Well, like any other beach if you don't surf, actually not good for swimmers, but a paradise if you surf longboards and want to see the surf scenery of CA.

This is a utopia on earthy!! The cafe has a great brunch menu and you can eat as you watch the waves, sea lions and surfers roll out in front of you on the Pacific. The true highlight of our trip to California and I couldn't recommend it highly enough. Do take the time to go you it - a real gem.
nice place for sunset and to eat a snack, you can surf right by eat and even see some dolphins from time to time
So quiet during the week ... for having lunch or simply a coffee while watching the birds on the pier, and the fish in the ocean ... A very good place to stop and relax a while when on the road ...
But I wouldn't come here for the pier. There are better ones farther south (Santa Monica, Newport and Balboa for instance).

This was an incredible experience. Being right above the pacific ocean is awesome! There are bathrooms, restaurants and gift shops on the pier. Parking is very convenient and the pier is very clean. Additionally, the pier is a great place to take pictures. If you're in Malibu, make sure to stop by the pier!

Funny isn't it, that victorians (c.1900) loved to walk over the sea on boardwalks. Well so much has changed, but that delight to walk over the sea remains. This one is a good one, not crowded when we were there (a thursday in October), some restaurants here, it appears, by the crowds, that the one right over the sea is better.
Easy enough to get to this pier if you know how to parallel park. Live to check out piers! Very clean!

column2: Do have lunch at Malibu Farm on the Pier
column3: What delight. The local organic food is mouth-wateringly delicious. And there you are, at sea, with a festive air. Malibu at its best for all ages. The pier makes for a nice stroll and a grand view. I take all of my guests.

This is a great place to take in the views of Malibu from the end of the pier. A lot of people come here to fish, so if you're into fishing don't forget your fishing rod! The restaurant at the beginning of the pier is gorgeous and the best calamari ever. The public washrooms are small and only accommodate one person at a time but they are clean!
If you drive you can park for free on the dock or street but was a easy walk from our hotel. Many restaurants and stores to check out and we found the area very clean and well maintained .

Lots of people having picnics, and fishing!when I mean lots, there are hundreds!People fighting for space, all over the place. looked like people were catching a lot too since there were lots of fish in the pails!this a really nice spot to check the sunset out just over your right shoulder!we took the time to watch the sun set over the water. it was quite fascinating!
The Malibu Pier was our first stop along the Pacific Coast Highway on our trip from LA to San Francisco. It was a beautiful area and the girls had alot of fun on the pier.

column2: Not much to do, the views are stunning though.
column3: We went on Malibu pier for the view, the view is stunning, this pier was made in 1908, there is not a lot to do here apart from look at the ocean and people watch. If you fish then there are lots of areas for you to do this on the pier. There is also a busy restaurant at the end which didn't look that clean so we gave it a miss.The views are stunning though and it's safe.

column2: Eat,walkabout or try your luck fishing
column3: Great surf shop at the end.Decided not go fishing ,however the locals great to talk with who were fishing.Not too much going on. It is a relaxed atmosphere with some restaurants. A place you can say been there done that. The retaurant food smelled great coming from the kitchen as we strolled by ,next trip will try a meal there.

Unfortunately the pier seems to have fallen on hard times and so there really wasn't anything going on when we were there. Looked like someone was trying to reopen the restaurant. Hope they do and it is successful as it was kind of a sad contrast to the energy at the Santa Monica Pier. Still a nice walk out to the end of pier, just disappointing you couldn't get a drink or coffee and sit to further enjoy the view.
Beautifulloved the surf shop at the end of the pier lovely local couple owned.smoothies and breakfast. I would have had breakfast there had I know they had redone the whole pier!!! Great place

Kids loved malibu pier for the fishing. They do rent everything you need at the end of the pier. Try to find Julio (lovely high school student) who has been amazing with my kids teaching them how to fish. Note, There's little else to do for kids than fish and watch surfers.

column2: What I picture when I think of Malibu
column3: I feel like I've seen it before in some movie or TV show. It's definitely worth a walk to the end. You feel like you're walking on a piece of history.

column2: Perfect small beach near the pier
column3: Great little swimming beach near the pier. Not much of a surf but the water was crystal clear. There were many families and young children taking advantage of the gentle waves.

We spent some time on Malibu Beach. Didn't want to get into the cold water so we walked to the pier and walked around for a bit. Looks like a fun place especially if you had young children with you. Plenty of places to get drinks and food.

column2: Great phot ops when visiting Malibu
column3: The Malibu Pier was a great way to unwind for a bit. I was sorry that we had just eaten, because there were several nice-looking options for meals. If we return, we will definitely check out one of these restaurants. There was also an adorable speed boat for a photo op for small children to "ride" on the pier. My 2-year-old loved it.The surrounding scenery was beautiful, and as I look at my pics, I can't decide which one I like more.There is also a staircase down to the beach, and great viewing of the surfers (but there are also designated areas for swimmers).All in all, it was a great way to spend a couple of hours.

column2: A Lovely Pier on Pacific Coast Highway 1. Well worth a stop.
column3: Stopped off in Malibu on way south on Pacific Coast Highway 1 (PCH1) and very glad I did as the pier was lovely.Okay it's just a pier but it is well maintained and the walk down to the end in the Californian sunshine looking at the beautiful blue ocean was great. At the start and end of the pier there are some nice whitewashed buildings and the food looked very good (a shame I had already eaten).There are people fishing from the pier but unlike with the pier in Ventura further north along PCH1 they seem to keep the pier cleaner as there was far less 'fish mess' than on the Ventura Pier.Well worth a short stop and a walk (only need 1/2 to 1 hour) but a great break from driving and there are plenty of bench's along the pier to stop and take in the stunning vista's.See photo's included with this review.

We came on peak wave day, watched the surfers in the distance and had some spectacular waves crashing underneath and around the pier. Enjoyed the restaurant on the pier as well, good food and very accommodating of our large family/children.

We visited the pier one night to have dinner and enjoy a sunset. I enjoyed seeing the fisherman trying to catch fish while we ate - cheap entertainment! The pier has been nicely reconstructed and a nice place to visit if you're in the Malibu area.

column2: Hard to park so drive down a bit.
column3: When looking for the pier we couldn't find a parking spot, so we kept driving South and noticed a sign that said "Coastal Access" and parked. There were stairs and we spent an hour walking along the beautiful beach looking at the multi-million dollar homes. The beach was empty and the sand beautiful. Don't bother the residents, but enjoy the beauty.
Malibu BEACH is awesome.The PIER... on the other hand is nothing to write home about. You can see the ocean like any other pier. It's small and there may be people fishing.

column2: Nice way to view the surf.
column3: The view of the surfers from the Malibu pier is quite classic and, even early, on an overcast day with small waves, as it was when we visited, there are the dedicated surfers out there doing their stuff.
Perfect location to get some great pictures. It was amazing to be able to walk down & put my feet in the water while admiring all the beauty nature has to offer. Time well spent. Malibu is beautiful!
fantastic view of the coast, excellent shopping and wonderful food. We had lunch at Duke's restaurant and enjoyed both the food and the view. Very nice staff.Too much traffic
A lot of people hang here. Great surf spot. Nice beach too. Pretty laid back and fairly clean beach.
I was sad to see the stores close down, but they are making a comeback...can't wait to see this beautiful landmark restored. The restaurants are a great place to hang out.

The Pier is old, and the state has promised for years to fix it up. The two restaurants there are closed. The only thing there is a nice small gift shop. It is pointless to go there. Free parking is hard to get.You would have to pay $10 to $20 parking, just to walk up and down water damaged, bird fesses covered wood planks?You are better off going to Santa Monica Pier, at least there you will get lots of entertainment.

If you looking for calm pier this is a good one. There is a restaurant at the end of pier facing ocean. It is next state beach. There is Malibu lagoon which beautiful with birds. Also at shore there couple of big pebbles/stones on the beach, where you can see live sea animals.Parking is expensive and difficult to get on a peak day. This pier is shown in couple movies for example taken 2 climax scene.

As far as Piers go this one is pretty sad I'm afraid. Santa Monica, Brighton & even Glenelg Pier all have a little bit more pizzazz ! It's great to see the public can fish off it but apart from a good coffee spot that's about it. Maybe it needed a sunny day but it was still a relaxing spot. I'm afraid it is also not the 'Rockford Car Park' , that's further north at a pay to enter car park !! Jimbo would not be happy !!
I love the peaceful walking there . I like the beautiful sunsets . I watch the surfers , the dolphins and I enjoy my relax !

I went with LA tours and it was beautiful drive to Malibu, the tour guide parked the bus on the car park, and told us that this was the car park where Jim Rockford`s trailer was filmed in Rockford Files. We had a walk on the Malibu pier with great views of the beach.
You can park in a paid lot and walk out on the pier which has places to eat and a curio shop. Also, you can watch the paddlers and surfers at Surfrider beach.
If you're in LA its a short drive up the coast. Great photo spot! Parking is limited so be prepared to search and shell out some cash.

A charming and very-well maintained pier with a nice cafe at the end. Good views looking back to the shoreline. And if you're into fishing - or want to try it - you can rent everything you need as well as get some good tips along the way. The Malibu Coast is dominated by private shorelines and only rarely broken with public access - this is a good place to enjoy if you're touring.
The restaurant was closed but it sounded good, farm fresh, organic and local. We would probably eat there sometime if it were open.

I came here because travellers advised it. But in my opinion, it was such a waste of time. Malibu is a very quiet place and boring. There was nothing at the pier, the cafe was closed, restaurant same and the souvenir shop was just rubbish!! Santa Monica is so much better for sure!! At least, I know what Malibu looks like now and I'll definitely not go back there!!!

We were driving through and decided to park and walk down the pier. It was a beautiful day nice and sunny, we got great pictures and enjoyed the panaromic views and watching the waves come in and just listening to the water and seeing the pelicans. It was an enjoyable experience.
it's not the Santa Monica Pier with the amusement park but I loved it and the pelicans walking around were great! :D

We parked on the street and walked to the end of the pier. The views were exceptional. Although he did not eat at the little farm stand restaurant at the end, it was busy and looked very inviting and yummy.

column2: Awesome cafe on the end of the pier
column3: The pier itself does not have much on it, but in my opinion if there is a pier you have to walk to the end and back. Getting to the end we found a cafe where we had lunch - Malibu farm shop. Wow the food was great ( although it was really busy and the food took ages to come out) who can argue though when you are waiting while looking out to sea.

Drove up and down the Pacific Coast Highway taking the beautiful sights of Malibu.The Pier is a beautiful spot to look back Malibu Beach and the mountains. Had breakfast at the pier at Malibu Farm, a Cafe that serves amazing food that is all local and organic. Both the food and people were amazing.There is also a little shop, which sells home decor and bits and pieces which was great also.
Weather was beautiful - nice and peaceful! Hopefully the restaurant will open soon to make this an ideal lunch date!
On the pier you can watch freah fish snatched up and served in the little deli attached. Also, if you like to feed birds, they are every where.

column2: Don't waste your time or money
column3: Seriously, go to Santa Barbara Pier or Huntington Beach Pier instead, this place sucks. Both have more class, better beaches around them and you won't get ripped off or hustled. Tourist trap, end of review
At this time of the year, not to shiny but with breeze, good to hang out alone or with friends or with family. Not to many visitors around. there's a cafe, didn't have chance to try. but seems nice

column2: Must see, for film buffs especially!
column3: If you are a fan of Forrest Gump, this is somewhere you really must visit. Malibu pier is where Forrest stops running and turns round to go home again. Cool place to visit, we went here on a tour so had limited time but still enjoyed it and it was great to say I have followed in Forrest's footsteps. Restaurant was closed when we were there and had been for a while so may be a good ideal to bring food with you.

The drive from woodland hills was beautiful. We loved just watching the surfers. Park just before the actual pier parking it was only $3.or on the street for free. We ate dinner at Dukes which was good food,a bit on the pricy side for what it was. But really enjoyable.
This place has a little of everything. IT has rides, bars, entertainment, great food every single corner you turn. Fantastic place to spen the day or evening.

We went out on this pier twice on our visit to Malibu. It was nice to be able to go out on the ocean and not have to take a boat. There were two pelicans that greeted us. They just sat there and let people take their picture with them. We love to view nature and the outdoors. There is a gift shop at the end of the pier that has really unique gifts and souvenirs. It is different than the normal souvenirs that you see everywhere you go. The restaurant/café was not open. It was under construction. I think it will be much nicer when that is up and running. People were fishing from the pier and it was just a nice way to enjoy the ocean. We recommend it!
I loved walking here in the early morning hours with my husband. We were fortunate to see a rare Arctic loon last January. The shop at the end of the pier has great gifts. Well worth the walk.

column2: Business on the pier are closed
column3: Took a walk on the pier in July, 2013. Surprisingly all business on the shore end and one of two on the ocean end are closed. I suspect the owners are asking excessive rent. This was a disappointment for such a fantastic location.

column2: Malibu Pier - don't forget your wallet
column3: This is very nice, however, I preferred the older Malibu Pier with couple of the restaurants that were affordable. Very expensive, typical Malibu.

Nothing exciting, but a nice stop to get a good view, enjoy the ocean breeze, and watch those anxiously awaiting pulls on their fishing lines! Monday afternoon visit, easy parking right at the pier, not crowded at this time. Restaurant wasn't open so we enjoyed our McDonalds take-out on a bench. Very pleasant - everyone keeps to themselves and no one trying to sell you their wares or services. I've heard the sunset is beautiful, but our schedule didn't allow time to enjoy... maybe next time.Relatively quick visit unless you are there to fish or watch the sunset.

I wouldn't call this visit exciting, it is just a pleasant experience to be by the ocean and watch some boats pass in the distance, a helicopter flying low over the water or many of the sea birds flying around. The sunset shouldn't be missed, wait for it!It is one of those memories that makes you feel good and happy that you took the time to stop at this historic pier.

Managed to get parked close to the pier, good start!Nice laid back atmoshpere on the pier, nobody trying to sell you anything.We had been recommended to eat at the Beachcomber Restaurant, but it had been shut down and was being re-furbed. So it was a takeaway from the Jack in the Box across the road and chill on the beach for the day!Plenty space on the beach right next to the pier, watching the surfers trying to catch a wave.Great chill day!

A perfect place to watch the sunset. It is crowded during the weekends and when the surf is up. But, it is a nice place to watch the sunset. Street parking is difficult on nice days. However, if you do find parking, there are restaurants, and shops within walking distance. When visiting Malibu, walking the pier, is the quintessential ocean experience.
The pier is sweet. Feels like you are stepping back into time. Definately stop if you are on the PCH.

I visited the community of Malibu, CA on April 17-2012.The weather was cool, but sunny but the surf and the beach was gorgeous. I would recommend to visit this place in Spring time,especially the little shops and the surrounding canyons.Definitely, I will be back later this year.I love the Pacific Coast Highway!
Beautiful place to walk and take in the locals. Sunset was beautiful and sunrise was awesome. Clean, friendly people and my little dog loved it too!
The whole pier is old and most of the shops and restaurants had closed down. Only a few people crab fishing and very little to see.Save your gas.

Unlike other tourist piers, Malibu is a laid back, easy on the eyes place to walk out and see the sunset or views of the ocean. When we were there, a wedding party was enjoying taking pictures of each other with the ocean background. At one end is the restaurant and at the other a gift shop, but people come to fish, people watch, spot a dolphin or two or pelican. Take some time to enjoy it and not rush from one end to the other and feel you have "done the Malibu Pier". with patience you may see something very interesting (people and wildlife). I had read the other reviews and expected to be disappointed; however, I think they may have "done the pier" as opposed to enjoying it.

column2: Malibu in all of it's simplicity
column3: The best part of the Malibu pier? It's a pier with a restaurant at one end, a gift shop at the other. In between the two ends? Just a pier. People can fish, sit, stare at the water, take pictures....whatever they want. No glitz, no glamour. Just a pier.

This was my first visit to the Malibu area and frankly I expected more. I stopped at numerous beach areas from Malibu south to San Diego. The Malibu area would rank at the bottom of the list. Maybe that is what the residents want. I always heard how Malibu had the most expensive real estate in America but frankly most shore homes in most areas of the New Jersey shore seem nicer. That said, the Pier is still a lovely area that offers great views of the ocean and mountains; I just expected more.

column2: Malibu Pier is a must see
column3: While in Malibu if you don't check out the Pier you are missing out. The pier has excellent ocean views and when you are at the end of the pier take the stairs up to the top of the buildings there for a great photo op of Malibu with the water in the foreground and the Mountains in the backround. Beautiful ! There is a gift shop there that has a lot of cool stuff that seems to be a little cheaper than the prices in the rest of Malibu.Hopefully some Restaurants will again appear in the two buildings that are vacant now. The pier is definitely a great place to walk to when spending some time in Malibu !
Fun place to walk out and get a view of the ocean. Was rebuilt a while back due to damage from a storm. It's classic Southern California. Parking can be difficult during the summer months.

Personally, Malibu is average because it is too mellow and not as enjoyable of a pier as many others in SoCal. I love Santa Barbara and Monica piers among others, because they both have created wonderful unique environments representative of their cities. Malibu doesn't have that sadly. Beaches are better if visiting.
Malibu is a nice leafy are to live, but there's just a pier there, nothing else to see or do. Maybe that's just the way the locals like it? If you don't go there, your not missing out on much.
This is a must see just because it has been there for a while and us easterners hear about it and wonder about it. Don't expect too much but take it all in and enjoy.

I went when there was not much going on and I loved it. Found a place to park easily. Usually it's bustling with people. Very enjoyable. Love the little gift shop where they all things GIDGET! Who is a bartender at DUKE'S on PCH. Down the street from the pier! AWESOME!

column2: Historic landmark that will take you just a few minutes to see.
column3: This place has expensive parking and is just a pier over the ocean. Stop if you have time, nothing missed if you don't.

What I would expect a real (not too touristy) good old-fashioned Californian pier should be. Unfortunately Ruby's restaurant where we had eaten in previous visits appeared to be closed. But a real chill-out of a pier nevertheless.
Restaurant only accepted cash, no credit cards. Not much to see or do on the pier. Parking is a nightmare!
If you are in Malibu it is worth stopping and walking on. It is too small to make it the focal point of a trip. I will visit again.

column2: A great place to keep cool and look cool too!
column3: Spent many summers in and around this pier. Use to have an great commercial deep sea fishing boat that left from Malibu Pier...Always a great destination by the water...

column2: Get Into The Ocean Without Getting Wet!
column3: If you are burning up inland, a great inexpensive place to hang out is The Malibu Pier. When Westlake is over 100' the Pier is around 80'. If you like to fish for free, this is for you. You will only catch perch, croaker (throw these back because of PCBs) Mackrel, and more rarely,Halibut. Just bring a clamp style umbrella for shade, a folding chair, and laze the day away fishing in cool temps. There is a burger joint at the end of the pier and there was a restaurant, which I hear just opened again. The Pier goes out about 300 yards into the ocean and has a great view of Surfrider beach. The only thing you may have to pay for is parking, always scarce in Malibu!
Restaurants and shops with no particular offers and atmosphere. Great location and view of the ocean.

I expected a lot more in terms of shops and restaurants, however, the pier is old and authentic. The ocean always looks wonderful and I enjoyed watching the boats. At the beginning of the pier is a nice restaurant and the wait staff was friendly despite our tiny order ( two cappucinos.) I wouldn't make a special trip to see it. Malibu is crowded and not especially welcome to tourists. We were on our way to visit friends in the Pacific Heights and we took the Pacific Coast Highway and decided to see Malibu. Not much to do there unless you are a young child.

column2: Malibu Pier is not the reason to come to Malibu.
column3: Totally normal . I personally preferred the crowd at Santa Monica Pier, and the view/attractiveness of Manhattan Beach's pier (name?)--and both are MUCH closer to central LA/W. Hollywood. Malibu took us about an HOUR to reach and we didn't drive during any particularly bad rush hours for traffic. Malibu AREA however, is definitely worth checking out on its own if time permits. Absolutely BEAUTIFUL with tons of ops for stunningly picturesque shots of anything from lush mountains, to unique architecture to beachfront activities and landscapes. Would go back to Malibu..next time skipping the pier:)
walking on it brings you back to the 40's and 50's...fun gift shop at the end, restaurant at the beginning, and hawaiin ice stand too!

I took my 17 year old daughter and she thought it was very nice That beng said, the rides are really for little kids. There is not a whole lot to do other than soak in the tmosphere which is very nice. There a ton of vendors selling everything one could imagine but we really spent about an hour as there isn't much to do.

column2: awesome gift shop at end of pier
column3: i had a little time to spare, so walked out to the pier, and there is a nice restaurant at the begining of pier, and and awesome gift shop at the end... so really cool gifts, and awesome they sell fish bait, if your gonna fish..

We went to the Malibu Pier our first night in town, as it came recommended by others. Thankfully we didn't spend the $10 for parking and found a spot on PCH. We walked up and down the pier and saw folks fishing (took a total of about 5 minutes) and then went to the only restaurant on the pier for dinner (Jimmy's I believe) and it was just OK and overpriced. Next time we will skip it.

Malibu pier is a bit sketchy and has only one restaurant to have lunch. You can walk the length of the pier but there is nothing really to do except admire the beach. Nothing like the Santa Monica pier and you still have to pay for parking. Not eally worth it.
It felt like a step back in time - nice way to spend a few hours.

column2: Nice setting, but food not the greatest.
column3: It was nice to be on the pier at night and it had a fun atmosphere. Although food and drinks are only average.
How can you miss the pier in Santa Monica. Its an LAS icon. Nothing too fancy but the energy is great.

column2: Glad to see the pier open, BUT restaurant was closed
column3: Stayed at a hotel down the street, walked to the pier with the hope of getting a drink and a bite to eat, but the Resturant was closed when, according to the posted hours, should have been open (Tuesday afternoon).Been vacationing in Malibu for 19 years and know how long this pier has struggled, so glad to see it open, but hope the management of it improves so it can stay open.
closes early and no parking anywhere. Panhandlers abound. Thieves everywhere. Watch your back.
We visited the Malibu Pier and the staff at the gift shop there were so friendly. One of them even came out on the pier and took some pictures of our family. Highly recommend!

We visited in March 2012 with two 8-yr-olds and found the pier to be quite entertaining. It was a cool afternoon, but we enjoyed watching the surfers, the boats and the birds. The kids had fun doing the same. We didn't attempt to visit the restaurants, so I can't comment on that, but we had a pleasant, quiet visit to Malibu Pier. Great photo ops!

Malibu Pier was my most recent road biking destination. I couldn't regret it. I think it features the best ambiance of any pier in the Los Angeles area. It's a calm place, not crowded, perfectly enjoyable on a sunny saturday. Also, the beach view is astonishing and invigorating. It's a bit off the Los Angeles area, but no visitor can miss this landmark, absolutely.
Malibu in general is a pretty cool place to walk around. I like to go at night and have dinner at one of the many great options.
Restaurants are good with a variety of places to choose from in price high to low $$ and cuisine. Parking is easier at night. night views from the pier are really cool especially with full moon.

column2: fun for a walk or stroll along this short pier but not much more
column3: great location, fine views up and down the Malibu coast, but can be hard to park and not much going on here. nevetheless, its a fun stop to look around and to hang out for a bit in Malibu.Tip---its right next to a pretty popular surf location so you can usually enjoy watching the local surfers catch a wave!

column2: Beautiful Ocean Views on the Moonlit Malibu Pier
column3: Wow. I had been here in my teens, after surfing and swimming on the beach, and it seems to have changed a great deal.The pier is beautiful.It is well kept and clean and well lit. I love piers but most are for fishing and can be a bit grungy, but this was NOT the case. The shops are clean, attractive, and full of interesting ocean themed products.There are also restaurants very close. I went with friends on a full moon night and found it to be very romantic, with very beautiful ocean views. Worth seeing day or night. Next time I'm visiting during the day, I'm going to the beach as well. Downside.. parking is kind of a bear...but be patient a spot will open up. Romance value at PM (full moon required) 9+.
With the loss of the Beachcomber and Ruby's there's not much to draw you to the pier any more. Sad.....

We went on December 28th, 2011 and that was the day the Beachcomber Cafe called it quits. The other restaurant down at the end of the pier, Ruby's, closed six months before. All that is left on this pier is a cute store at the end and a nice view. The adjacent beach (Surfrider) is a cute little beach. During the off-season, check for street parking before paying at the pier parking or the beach parking.

column2: Make a pit stop for a stroll along the pier & beach
column3: On our road trip along the PCH, we made a whim to stop here once we saw Malibu pier sign. We were able to find street parking by luck close to the fast food joint across the pier. Views from this pier were beautiful. We spotted a couple of people kayaking and paddle boarding as they launched from the beach . At the end of the pier, there’s a cool shop selling Malibu souvenirs and fisherman getting their catch of the day. We walked under pier along to the adjacent beach watching the surfers do their thing. A very low key pier compared to other piers. Nice to take a break from driving and enjoy the coastline.

column2: Fun environment - the food isn't why you are there...
column3: Sitting on the beach - it's great, but sometimes the music is way too loud to enjoy your friends.
Stunning, stunning, stunning. Highly reccomend. Not to be believed.

We went there riding our rental car and we found a starbucks and a small supermarket on the right.was a very nice riding and very nice views, we realyy enjoyed it and we also enjoyed the graet coffee with the cake in star bucks, also the weather was great. whenver we go to LA again , we will sure go again to this area.

the pier itself is fine, but the owners/operators of the boat tours and store are horrible. they have lied to me several times and always overbook their tours, so i ended up never being able to use a tour voucher i was given as a gift. they literally lied to my face and then refused to fix the situation. not to mention the pier store is extremely overpriced. worse customer service i've ever experienced.
Deceiving. Nothing to see, nothing interesting to do. Avoid the 20 miles drive from LA.

column2: A definite must-see when you go to Malibu
column3: What's a trip to a seaside community without visiting either its boardwalk or the pier? Now this is NOT the longest pier in the state (Oceanside, CA has that honor) but it is significant to the history of Malibu...and just a fun place to visit. Initially it was put in as the Rindge family's personal pier but is now owned by the State of California. The pier has had its ups and downs...it is the former location of the famed Alice's Restaurant. Alice's is gone, but there are newer and trendier restaurants coming to the pier and it's also just a nice place to fish or just engage in quiet reflection...or the watch the surfer at nearby Surfrider Beach.
